By greeting the household and wishing it peace, Then it may be that peace you’ll impart. But when they refuse you or turn you away, Shake the dust from your feet and depart.’

Damara: Sa ǁaeb tsî ǁgui-ǂgā-sens tsîn ra ǀga-pi-ǃgôa-he, E-lob Gao-si-bats ra ôa hî-na. Nēs ge ǃgâib tsî ǀam-o ûib tsî-na nî mā tsi, ûib ǃgâi xū-na nî-ra hau-ba. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēb ge a-ma-ba. Ûi-ǂui tsî a-ma kai re. Tsî ǃgâi-a-ǂgao re Je-ho-vab ǀkhaeb ǀkha, a-mab ǃnâts ta ǀgai hî-na.
English: All those who receive you receive him as well, Respond when their heart opens wide. Their right disposition for unending life Will impel them to serve at your side. And never be anxious about what to say, For Jehovah will help you to speak. Your answer when gracious and seasoned with salt Will appeal to the humble and meek.

Damara: ǃKhūb si-da ǁGûb ai-ǃâ da ǀgôa-ron kha-mi ī, hî-na ǁîb dao-ǁgau-de ǂhâ hâ-na. A da si-da ǀhom-si ǁGûb ǀkha ǀgui-ba ǃgû re, î da hâ-hâ nî ǀkhae-ba hō. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēb ge a-ma-ba. Ûi-ǂui tsî a-ma kai re. Tsî ǃgâi-a-ǂgao re Je-ho-vab ǀkhaeb ǀkha, a-mab ǃnâts ta ǀgai hî-na.
English: As we tell about the Kingdom, As we witness for your name, There are many who oppose us And who try to bring us shame. But instead of fearing men, It’s really you we must obey. So we beg you now for your spirit; O Jehovah, hear what we pray. (CHORUS) Grant us boldness as we witness; Help us overcome our fear. Give us confidence and courage So that all the world may hear. Armageddon draws ever near, But until that great day is here, Grant us boldness as we witness. This is our prayer.

Damara: Hoa-ǁae da ge E-lo-ba ra ǁgae ǂgao, khoen ǀkha ǂhau-ǃnâ-se ûi-sa, ǁÎb kha-mi. E-lob di ǁkho-reb ge khoe-na sâu-sa, ǁîb ge hoa-na ǁîb ǀgôan a-se ra mû. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhai ta-mas ge khoe-i ge, ai ta-mas ge ǁîn ǂgaob ge. Hoa-na da ge E-lob xa nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā. Tsâ-ba nî da ra ǃkhais ǃgao da ge hoa-ba ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǁÎn nî E-lob di ǀhō-sa kai ǁkhā-se.”
English: Even though we may be fearful, You remember we are dust. Your assurance to support us Is a promise we can trust. Give attention to the threats Of those who persecute and blame. May you help us all to continue As we boldly speak in your name. (CHORUS) Grant us boldness as we witness; Help us overcome our fear. Give us confidence and courage So that all the world may hear. Armageddon draws ever near, But until that great day is here, Grant us boldness as we witness. This is our prayer.

Damara: Hân ra ǃkhais ge ǂhâ-ǂhâ-sa ta-ma hâ. Tsî ǁîn ra ta-ni-sen ǀgaub tsî-na o. Xa-we ǂhâ-ǂhâ-sa as ge ǁîn ǂgao-ba— Je-ho-va E-lob ge ǁî-na a ǀnam. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhai ta-mas ge khoe-i ge, ai ta-mas ge ǁîn ǂgaob ge. Hoa-na da ge E-lob xa nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā. Tsâ-ba nî da ra ǃkhais ǃgao da ge hoa-ba ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǁÎn nî E-lob di ǀhō-sa kai ǁkhā-se.”
English: Today men heap reproach and shame Upon Jehovah’s holy name. Some show God weak; some paint him cruel. “There is no God,” so shouts the fool. Who’ll go Jehovah’s name to clear? Who’ll sing his praise for all to hear? (CHORUS

Damara: Je-ho-vab ge hoa khoe-na ra ǀkho-ma, în ǃhūb-aib tsî ǁîb sî-sen-ga ǁnā-xū. Nē-sa da ǂan ǁnās ǀkha da ra ao-ǁnâ. Tsî da ge hoa khoen ǀkha ra ǀgo-ra-gu. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhai ta-mas ge khoe-i ge, ai ta-mas ge ǁîn ǂgaob ge. Hoa-na da ge E-lob xa nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā. Tsâ-ba nî da ra ǃkhais ǃgao da ge hoa-ba ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǁÎn nî E-lob di ǀhō-sa kai ǁkhā-se.”
English: ‘Lord, here I am! Send me, send me! I’ll sing your praises faithfully. No greater honor could there be, Lord. Here I am! Send me, send me!’

Damara: Je-sub ge ra mî: ‘A-mab nî ǁnâu-he,’ so-res tsî tsa-rab ǃnâs tsî-na. Hoan E-lob xa nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen. Nau gū-na ǀnam tsî a-mab xa mî-ba. Hoa ǃhūb-aib ǃnân ge-re ôa-he, ǁgoa-sa xu tsēs ǀams. Om-sa xu oms ǀkha ǃgan-gu ǃnâ, hoa-ǁae da ge khoen ǀkha nî ǃhoa. Khoen ǃgom-si-gu ge ǀgū-ǁae nî ū-bē-he. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Hā re da ôa. ǂKhîb di ǀhō-sa-na hoa ǃhao-di ǃnâ. Ôa da ge ra, mā-sen-xa ǂgao-ga o-re-hes xa. Khoe-e ǁnā-xū ǂui ta-ma-se.
English: Some make the claim that God is slow; The fear of God they do not know. Some worship idols made of stone; Some would put Caesar on God’s throne. Who’ll tell the wicked what’s in store? Who’ll warn of God’s great final war?  (CHORUS

Damara: Ôas ge ra ai-ǃgû, ǁaeb go toa xa-we. ǂGui ǂgao-gu tsî ûi-gu tsî-na, da ge ra ôa hoa ǃhao-di ǃnâ. ǀNam-mi ge ra ǂgae da nē-sa dī-sa. Tsû hâ ǂgaob ge a ǂgau ǁkhā, ǁgai hâ ûib ge nî ǃgâi. Om-di tsî ǃgan-gu ǃnâ ra ôa, khoen ǂgao-ga da nî tsâ-ǀkhā-se. Nē-sa da ge kai ǂkhîb ǀkha hoa-ǁae ra dī. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Hā re da ôa. ǂKhîb di ǀhō-sa-na hoa ǃhao-di ǃnâ. Ôa da ge ra, mā-sen-xa ǂgao-ga o-re-hes xa. Khoe-e ǁnā-xū ǂui ta-ma-se.
English: ‘Lord, here I am! Send me, send me! I’ll sound the warning fearlessly. No greater honor could there be, Lord. Here I am! Send me, send me!’

Damara: E-lo-ba koa. Hā î da ǁnae! ǁÎb ge ûib tsî xūn hoa-na ra mā da. Mâ tsēs hoa-sa da ra koa bi, ǁÎb di ǀnam-mi tsî hoa-ǀgai-xa-sib ǃgao. ǁNaes tsî ǁÎb kai ǀons xa ao-ǁnâs ǃnâ-ū.
English: Today the meek ones mourn and sigh Because the evils multiply. With honest hearts they seek to find The truth that gives real peace of mind. Who’ll go with comfort to the meek? Who’ll help them righteousness to seek? (CHORUS

Damara: E-lo-ba koa. ǁÎb ra ǂkhî kai. Si-da ǀgo-re-deb ra ǁnâu tsîb ra hui. ǁÎb ge hoa-ǁae khoe-na ra hui. ǁÎb di ga-gab ge tsau-ra-na ra hui. A da ǁÎb bu-ru-xa ǀgaib xa koa bi.
English: ‘Lord, here I am! Send me, send me! I’ll teach the meek ones patiently. No greater honor could there be, Lord. Here I am! Send me, send me!’

Damara: E-lo-ba koa. ǁÎb ǂha-nu-ai. ǁÎb ra ǁkhae-ǂgao da, ǁÎb ǃnâ da ra ǂgom. E-lob ǁgai-ba nî-ra ǃgâi-ǃgâi. Gao-sib ǀkhae-gan ge khoe-na nî hō-ǃâ. A da ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha hoa-ǁae koa bi!
English: How does it make you feel when you preach and teach with zeal, When you know you’ve done your part to reach an honest heart? Knowing you’ve done your best; then our God will do the rest. Honest hearts he surely knows— all those to him disposed. (CHORUS) It makes us glad, and we rejoice to give our heart and mind and voice. So may our sacrifice of praise continue all our days.

Damara: ǃGâi ǂâi-ba-sens ǀkha da ge ra ǃhoa în hoa-na ǁnâu. ǁÎb ǁaib di tsēs go hā-sa, în hoa-na ǃgâi-ǃgâi-sen. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge hoa da ûib xa ra ǃhoa khoe da hoa da ǃkhō-ǂgā hâ. Nēb ge ǁîn ûi, ǁnâun ga ra o. An hoa khoe-na nēs xa ǁnâu re, nēs xa ǂan.
English: How does it make you feel when the words you speak appeal To the ones whose heart is right for everlasting life? Some people turn away, others might be led astray. Still we’re glad to bear his name and witness just the same. (CHORUS) It makes us glad, and we rejoice to give our heart and mind and voice. So may our sacrifice of praise continue all our days.

Damara: ǁÎb mîs xa da ra ao-ǁnâ, hoa khoen a ǁnâu ǁkhā-se. Tsî da khoe-na ra ǁkhau în E-lob ǀkha ǂkhî-ba-gu. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge hoa da ûib xa ra ǃhoa khoe da hoa da ǃkhō-ǂgā hâ. Nēb ge ǁîn ûi, ǁnâun ga ra o. An hoa khoe-na nēs xa ǁnâu re, nēs xa ǂan.  (ǀUNIS) ǃGâ du re tsî du ǁnâu re. An khoe-na ǃgâ tsî ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen. ǁÎ-na da ge nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā ǀAm-o ûi-ba nî hō ǁkhā-se.  (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge hoa da ûib xa ra ǃhoa khoe da hoa da ǃkhō-ǂgā hâ. Nēb ge ǁîn ûi, ǁnâun ga ra o. An hoa khoe-na nēs xa ǁnâu re, nēs xa ǂan.
English: How does it make you feel, knowing God’s support is real, And that he’s entrusted you to do the work we do? Proudly we preach and teach, using bold but gracious speech, Searching out deserving ones; this work will soon be done. (CHORUS) It makes us glad, and we rejoice to give our heart and mind and voice. So may our sacrifice of praise continue all our days.

Damara: A da ǁa-po-sa-se mâ-ǀgai ǀams ǁaeb ǃnâ, î da E-lob ǃgâi-ǂhôa-sa hoa-ǁae ǁkhau-ba ǁkhā. ǁGâ-uab ge mâ-ǃoa tsî ra ǃgam da. Je-ho-vab huib ǀkha da ge ra mâ-ǃoa bi. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǀHû-ǀgui-ti-mî-aon a-se mâ-ǀgai tsî ai-ǃgû! ǂKhî re, ǃKhūb ǃoa-bas ǃnâ da ǃâ-e ū-hâ-sa! A da khoe-na mî-ba Pa-ra-dais go ǀgū-sa. Tsî ǀgū-ǁae i ge ǁnā ǀkhae-ba nî hā.
English: Our service to God we cherish; We value our priv’lege to preach. We buy out the time and give God our best, For many we still need to reach. (CHORUS) God’s Word invites us: ‘Come taste and see— See that Jehovah is good.’ Godly devotion brings greatest gain, We know we’ve done all we could.

Damara: Je-ho-vab khoen ge ǃkhū-si-ba ôa ta-ma tsî nē ǃhūb-aib ǂgae-ǂgui-ao-ga ǂkhî-ǂkhî ta-ma. Tsî ǃhūb-aib ǂnao-e ū-hâ ta-ma, ǂgom-ǂgom-sa-se da hoa-ǁae nî-ra mâ hō. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǀHû-ǀgui-ti-mî-aon a-se mâ-ǀgai tsî ai-ǃgû! ǂKhî re, ǃKhūb ǃoa-bas ǃnâ da ǃâ-e ū-hâ-sa! A da khoe-na mî-ba Pa-ra-dais go ǀgū-sa. Tsî ǀgū-ǁae i ge ǁnā ǀkhae-ba nî hā.
English: For those in the full-time service, Rich blessings and treasures abound. By trusting in God to care for our needs, In all things contentment is found. (CHORUS) God’s Word invites us: ‘Come taste and see— See that Jehovah is good.’ Godly devotion brings greatest gain, We know we’ve done all we could.

Damara: Khoen ge E-lob di Gao-si-ba ra ǂkhā-bē, ǁÎb ǀon-san ǃkhā-ǃkhā tsî ǂan-ǃgâ ǂgao ta-ma hâ. A da ǁÎb ǀon-sa ǃa-nu ǃa-nu, tsî hoa ǃhao-di tsî ǁae-di ǃnâ nî ǂan-ǂan. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǀHû-ǀgui-ti-mî-aon a-se mâ-ǀgai tsî ai-ǃgû! ǂKhî re, ǃKhūb ǃoa-bas ǃnâ da ǃâ-e ū-hâ-sa! A da khoe-na mî-ba Pa-ra-dais go ǀgū-sa. Tsî ǀgū-ǁae i ge ǁnā ǀkhae-ba nî hā.
English: At the start of the day, with the sun yet to rise, We are making our way with the sleep in our eyes, and we pray. We are there with a smile for the people we meet. Some may stop for a while, some pass by on the street, but we stay. (CHORUS) It’s the life that we choose; For Jehovah we live. And whatever he asks, we will do. In the work we endure, Whether sunshine or rain. It’s a way we can say ev’ry day: “I love you.”

Damara: ǁKhoa-se E-lo-ba ǀa-sa ǁnae-ams ǃnâ-ū koa re. Khoe-na mî-ba re nē-si ǃgâi xūn dīb ran xa. ǁÎb ge a ǃgâi-ǃōb di E-lo, ǀkhī da koa bi re. ǁÎb ge ǂha-nu-ai-sib ǃnâ-ū ra ǀgo-ra-ǃgâ. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Nē ǀa-sa ǁnae-am-sa! ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Je-ho-vab ge Gao-ao.
English: At the end of the day, with the sun sinking low, Feeling happy and tired, in our heart there’s a glow, and we pray. It’s a life that we love, always giving our best. And Jehovah we thank, for by him we are blessed ev’ry day. (CHORUS) It’s the life that we choose; For Jehovah we live. And whatever he asks, we will do. In the work we endure, Whether sunshine or rain. It’s a way we can say ev’ry day: “I love you.”

Damara: ǃGâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha si-da E-lob tsî Gaob ǃoa ǁnae re! ǁÎb ǀon-sa ǃgôa-si-ba ǁgau nē ǁnae-ams ǃnâ-ū. Kai-se ǂgui khoe-nan ǁhao re, ǃKhūb ai-ǃâ ra ǁnae-na. ǃGa-ri ǀoa-sa dom-mi ǀkha E-lo-ba koa re. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Nē ǀa-sa ǁnae-am-sa! ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Je-ho-vab ge Gao-ao.
English: From house to house, from door to door, Jehovah’s word we spread. From town to town, from farm to farm, Jehovah’s sheep are fed. The good news that God’s Kingdom rules, As Jesus Christ foretold, Is now declared throughout the earth By Christians young and old.

Damara: Ab hu-rib ǃnâ ǁan hân hoa-na E-lo-ba koa re. Khoe-nan ǁhao re ǃga-ri dom-gu ǀkha ǁnaes ǃnâ-ū. Ab ǃhū-ba dâ re tsî ǃā-ga ǁîb ǃom-ga ǁâ-bu. ǃHom-gu ǀga-pi-gu tsîn ge ǃhūb hoab ǃnâ ra ǁnae. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Nē ǀa-sa ǁnae-am-sa! ǁNae, ǁnae, ǁnae! Je-ho-vab ge Gao-ao.
English: From house to house, from door to door, Salvation we proclaim. It comes to those who make the choice To call upon God’s name. But how can they respect the name Of One they do not know? To ev’ry home and ev’ry door, The sacred name must go.

Damara: Khoen ǀui-na ra e-lo dī, xa-wen E-lo-ba a ǀū. Hoa-ǀgai-xa E-lo-ba, tib ge a ǂan-sa. Nau e-lo-gu ge mû ǁoa hā-nî-ǁae nî ī xū-na. Si-da ai-ǃâ gu ge xū ta-ma, ǁî-gu ge a ǁgau-ǁgau-sen ǁoa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab di khoe da ge. ǃAo ta-ma-se da ra ǃhoa. Je-ho-vab ge ra a-ma kē-bo, mîb ta xūn ra a-ma kai.
English: So let us go from door to door To spread the Kingdom news. And whether it’s embraced or not, We’ll let the people choose. At least we’ll name Jehovah’s name, His glorious truth declare. And as we go from door to door, We’ll find his sheep are there.

Damara: ǁKhoa-se da ra ǁîb xa ǃhoa tsî kai-sib â-ba ǃkhō-am. Gao-sib ǂhôas xa da ge khoe-na ra ǂan-ǂan. Khoe-na da ra mû-ǃā kai a-mab ra ǃno-ra kai-sa. ǀGain ga ra o, on ra ǃhoa tsoa-tsoa. ǃKhūb ǃoa nē koa-tsa-na-sa ǁnae. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab di khoe da ge. ǃAo ta-ma-se da ra ǃhoa. Je-ho-vab ge ra a-ma kē-bo, mîb ta xūn ra a-ma kai.
English: Welcome to all who gather here this day To hear God’s Word and to learn his way. Life-giving truth he offers to us all; With thankfulness of heart, we respond to his call.

Damara: ǁÎb ǀon-sa da ra kai-kai, ǃkhā-ǃkhās tsî taob tsî-kha xu. Tsî khoe-na ra ǃkhâi-khom, mâ-ǃoa bi ra-na. ǀÛ-bab ge ra hoa khoe-na, ǁÎb ǃoan ga ǁkha-wa hā o. ǂGaob hoab ǀkha ǃoa-bas ge ra dâ kai, ǀam-o ûib mî-mâis ge nî hâ. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab di khoe da ge. ǃAo ta-ma-se da ra ǃhoa. Je-ho-vab ge ra a-ma kē-bo, mîb ta xūn ra a-ma kai.
English: Thanks to our God for brothers such as these, Who welcome us and who seek to please. May we keep holding men of that sort dear, And now we welcome others who meet with us here.

Damara: Nēs ge kai ǃē-sa ū da hâ-sa, ǀhao-ǀhaos ǁaeb ǃnâ da nē-si hâ. Tsau-ra khoen ge si-da ai-ǃâ mâ, hoa da ge ǃâ-e ra ǀhu-ru. Je-sub ge ai-ǁgau-sa ge ǁgau da, nē sî-sen-ni ǃnâ dao-ǁgaus ǀkha. Kai-se da ǂkhî tsî ǃgôa-sa-se ra tsâ. Kai ǂkhîb ǀkha da nē-sa ra dī.
English: God’s invitation reaches all mankind, That all sincere ones the truth may find. God by his Son has drawn us to His side. So welcome one another with hearts opened wide.

Damara: E-lob tsî khoe-na a-ma ǀnams ge, nē sî-sen-e nî-ra ǃhae kai. Ao-ǁnâs ge a ǁga-ri-ǁga-ri-sa, ǀams go kai-se ǀgū xui-ao o. Hō da ra ǀkhaeb ge ra dâ kai da, Je-ho-vab ra mā da ǀkhaeb ge. ǂGoms ǃnâ-ū ǀgui da ge nî-ra mâ-ǀgai tsî ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha ǁîb ǀkhāb ai.
English: Come with rejoicing, and learn about Jehovah. “Come drink life’s water,” the spirit has said. Healthful instruction, God has provided. All those who hunger for truth will be fed.

Damara: Ai-ǃgû re, ai-ǃgû re î du mâ-ǀgai ǁkhā! A-mab ǃnâ ǀgai în hoa khoe-na ǃgā-sa-se mû re. A da ai-ǃgû re ao-ǁnâ sî-sen-ni ǃnâ tsî E-lob ai ǂgom-ai-ǂnûi. Hoa da ai-ǂha-nub ge ao-ǁnâ-sa. Je-sub tsîn ge nē-sa ge-re dī. E-lob ai kō re ǂkhâ-ǃnâ-hes ǃa-ro-ma mâ-ǀgai ǂha-nu-ai-sib ǃgao.
English: Never forsaking our gathering together, We must be taught; we must learn what is right. Here with God’s spirit, here with our brothers, Here we are strengthened to walk in the light.

Damara: Ai-ǃgû re, ai-ǃgû re, ǁkhoa-se ao-ǁnâ re! ǃGâi-ǂhôa-sa în hoa ǃhao-di khoe-na nē-sa ǁnâu ǁkhā. ǁHao re si-da E-lob tsî Gao-ba koas ǃnâ. Khoen ǀkha da ra ǃhoa hî-na. Mâ-ǃoa-aon ǂhâ-ba hâ î da ǃao xa-we da ǁgoe oa ta-ma, ǃhoas ǀkha. Ao-ǁnâ re Je-ho-vab di Gao-sib ǂhôan xa. A-mab xa ǀgui ǁkhā-ǁkhā re.
English: Lips that sing praise, how encouraging to hear them! Tongues of the taught ones, how sweet is their sound! Oh, may we always meet with God’s people! Oh, may we always among them be found!

Damara: Ai-ǃgû re, ai-ǃgû re, nē sî-sen-ni ǃnâ. Tsî ǁkhā-si-ba hō, ǂgui sî-sen-ni ge hâ dī-sa. Tsî âb E-lob ga-ga-ba dao-ǁgau da re. Î da E-lob ǂkhî-ba hō. A da ǀhao-ū da ra khoe-na ǀnam. Tsî ǁîn ǂgaob tsî ǂâis tsî-na tsâ-ǀkhā. Tsî hui nî în ǀgai tsî ǀkha-ra-ǀkha-ra-he, a-mab ge ǁnās ǀkha nî ǂkhai.
English: We live in a world that is wayward and lost; The way of our God is not known. We need sure direction to safeguard our steps; We cannot succeed on our own. Our meetings refresh us and brighten our hope; They help us build faith in our God. They move us with words that incite to fine deeds, They give us the strength to go on. We’ll never forsake what Jehovah commands; His will is what we want to do. Our meetings instruct us in ways that are right; Our love for the truth they renew.

Damara: Gao-sib a-mab ge ga-xu-se ge ǀū-he i. Mî-mâi-sa Gaob, a-mab ge nē-si ǀgui ra ǂhai. Je-ho-vab ge ǁîb kai ǀkhom-mi tsî ǀnam-mi ǃgao, si-da ǁo-re-xa mâ-sib xa ge tsâ-ǀkhā-he. ǁÎb ǀGôa-bab ge ǃhūb-aib Gao-se ge a ǁgau-mâi. E-lob ǁaeb aib ge Gao-sib ǂgae-ǂgui-sa nî tsoa-tsoa. Tsîb ge ǀGôa-ba ta-ra-sa nî-ra ǀkhī-ū-ba. ǁHûi-he hâ ǂkha-ri ǃgu-bis di khoen ge a ǁî.
English: Jehovah is keenly aware of our needs; His counsel by us should be heard. To buy out the time for occasions to meet Shows wisdom and trust in his Word. By wholesome instruction from God-fearing men, We learn how our faith can be shown. With loving support from our fam’ly of faith, We know that we’re never alone. So as we look forward to much better times, We’ll meet with the ones whom we love. And here at these meetings we’ll learn how to live With wisdom that comes from above.

Damara: Ao-ǁnâ da ra ǃgâi-ǂhôas ge ǀnai ge ǂan-sa i. Î da nē ǁaeb ǃnâ E-lob ǂâi-sa ǁgui-ǃā ǁkhā. Si-da ǀkha gu ǀhom-ǃgā-ga dâb ǀkha ra sî-sen. ǁÎ-gu ge ra hui Gao-sib xa da nî ǃhoa-sa. Nē sî-sen-na da ge ǃgôa-si-ba ū-ba hâ. Î da ǁîb ǀon-sa ǃa-nu kai tsî ǃgâi-se koa bi. ǂNī-sa da ge a ǁîb di ǀons ai ǂgai-he-sa tsî ǀam-o ǃgâi-ǂhôas hî-na da ra ao-ǁnâs ǀkha.
English: We’re gathered together, Jehovah our God, Accepting your warm invitation. Your Word is a lamp that lights up our pathway, The source of divine education. (CHORUS) Teach me your ways, and make me understand; Incline my ear to hear your wise command. Cause me to walk in ways of truth and right, And make your law my principal delight.

Damara: E-lob ge hoa da mî-mā hâ, ǁÎb ge ǃe-re-am-sa mā da hâ o. Î da hoa-ǁae khoe-na ao-ǁnâ-ba, si-da ǂgao-gu ǃnâ hâ ǃâu-ba-sens xa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Mî-sa ao-ǁnâ, în hoa khoe-na ǁnâu-si re! Ao-ǁnâ re, ǂan da a ǀams ge go ǀgū. Ao-ǁnâ re, tsau-ra-na hui în ǁnâu-ǃā. Ao-ǁnâ re, ǃhūb-aib hoab ǃnâ!
English: Unreachably high is your wisdom, O God; Your judgments we find reassuring. Your Word is a source of unending wonder; Your sayings of truth are enduring. (CHORUS) Teach me your ways, and make me understand; Incline my ear to hear your wise command. Cause me to walk in ways of truth and right, And make your law my principal delight.

Damara: ǃGom ǁae-gu ge nî hā-ǂam da, mâ-ǃoa-aon ge nî-ra tao-tao da ǂgao. ǀAms ra ǀgū kha-mi ī ga mû-sen, xa-we da E-lob ai ra ǂgom-ai-ǂnûi. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Mî-sa ao-ǁnâ, în hoa khoe-na ǁnâu-si re! Ao-ǁnâ re, ǂan da a ǀams ge go ǀgū. Ao-ǁnâ re, tsau-ra-na hui în ǁnâu-ǃā. Ao-ǁnâ re, ǃhūb-aib hoab ǃnâ!
English: If we have listened to Christ, will we show it? His teaching shines as it shows us the way. It makes us happy to hear and to know it, But we’ll be blessed if we know and obey. (CHORUS) Listen, obey, and be blessed When you hear God’s will expressed. If you’d be happy and enter his rest, Listen, obey, and be blessed.

Damara: ǃGâi ǁae-ga da ge nî-ra mû tsî ǁkhā-ǁkhās ǂhâ-sib ge kai-se a kai. Khoen o-res xa da ge ra ao-ǁnâ tsî ra hui ǃKhūb ǀon-sa ǃa-nu kais ǀkha. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Mî-sa ao-ǁnâ, în hoa khoe-na ǁnâu-si re! Ao-ǁnâ re, ǂan da a ǀams ge go ǀgū. Ao-ǁnâ re, tsau-ra-na hui în ǁnâu-ǃā. Ao-ǁnâ re, ǃhūb-aib hoab ǃnâ!
English: Our way of life, like a house, gives protection When it is built on the rock, not on sand. If we apply Jesus’ loving direction, We’ll build a life which on bedrock will stand. (CHORUS) Listen, obey, and be blessed When you hear God’s will expressed. If you’d be happy and enter his rest, Listen, obey, and be blessed.

Damara: A da Je-sub sî-sen-ni ǃnâ ǁhao, ǁî-ba ǃe-re-am tsî ǁnâu-ǀnam. ǁÎb ge ra hui da tsî dao-ǁgau da. ǁÎb ǁkhā-ǁkhās ge dao-ba ra ǁgau. Gao-sib a-mab ge kai ǀgai-ba ū-hâ ǂhau-ǃnâ tsî ǃgâi khoen ǂgao-gu ǃnâ. A da ǁkhā da ân hoa-na ǂhau-ǃnâ-se dī mā-he da hâ sî-sen-ni ǃnâ-ū.
English: Just as a tree rooted deep by the waters Gives of its fruit when each season arrives, If we obey as God’s own sons and daughters, We’ll all be blessed and enjoy endless lives. (CHORUS) Listen, obey, and be blessed When you hear God’s will expressed. If you’d be happy and enter his rest, Listen, obey, and be blessed.

Damara: Nē sî-sen-ni ǃnâ da ra ǃgâi-ǃō, nēs ge ǁgui-ǂgā-sen-sa xu hâ. Sa-da ra ǃgân ge hui-ba ǂhâ hâ în ǂan tsî a-ma-ba ǀnam ǁkhā. Hui nî re în ǁgâi-ba ta-ni hō-ǁkhā nē daob ain ge xū-na nî mû. A-mab ge ǂkhî-ba nî mā da mû da ga, ma-tin tsēs hoa-sa ra kai ǀgau-sa.
English: As we encourage one another To serve Jehovah faithfully, We find the bonds of love are strengthened; Fine works bring peace and unity. The love we find among God’s people Gives each the courage to endure. Our congregation is a refuge, A place where we can feel secure.

Damara: Ai-ǃgû re Gao-sib xa ao-ǁnâ-sa khoe-na du ra ǀhao-ū-ba. A da ǀgū-khoe-na ǂgao-ba xu ǀnam tsî hui nî re în mâ-ǀgai. Ai-ǂha-nub ge ǃKhū-ba ǃoa-ba-sa. ǁÎb mî-sa da ǂkhîb ǀkha ra ǂhôa. ǃGû-ǂoa re î da ao-ǁnâ ǀga-ra tsî E-lob ǃa-nu ǀons xa ǃhoa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Ai-ǃgû re, ǁkhoa-se Gao-sib di hai-si-am-sa ao-ǁnâs ǀkha. Ai-ǃgû re, î da ǂgom-ǂgom-sa-se Je-ho-vab ǀkhāb ai mâ.
English: A word when spoken at the right time Is, oh, how comforting to hear! We hear these words of consolation From friends so faithful and so dear. How good it is to work together With those whose hopes and goals we share! We seek to strengthen one another And help each one his burden bear.

Damara: ǀGui-ba da ais-ǀkhā-ba ǃoa nî kō, ǃa-nun tsî Nau gūn tsî-na. Nēs ǂkham-an tsî kai-ra-na xu hâ, a-mab daob ǃnâ hâ-hâs ǃgao. Je-ho-vab hā-nî Gao-sib ǃgâi-ǂhôas xan ge hoa khoe-na nî-ra ǁnâu. ǁÎb ge ǀgai-ba ra mā ao-ǁnâs ǃgao. ǁÎb ǀkha da xū-e ǃao ti-de! (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Ai-ǃgû re, ǁkhoa-se Gao-sib di hai-si-am-sa ao-ǁnâs ǀkha. Ai-ǃgû re, î da ǂgom-ǂgom-sa-se Je-ho-vab ǀkhāb ai mâ.
English: As we with eyes of faith are seeing The nearness of Jehovah’s day, We need our gathering together To keep us walking in the way. United with Jehovah’s people, We hope to serve eternally. So we encourage one another To hold to our integrity.

Damara: Gao-sib xa ao-ǁnâs tsî a-mab xa ǁkhā-ǁkhās ge E-lob xa ra dao-ǁgau-he. ‘ǁNān hî-na ra ǃgâ tsî ū-ǃoa-na ôa re, ga-ga-si ǂhâ-si-ba ū-hâ-na. Oms di khoe-na kai ǂkhîb ǀkha ta-we-de re, î du ǂkhîb xa ǁî-na mî-ba ǁkhā. Xa-wen ga ǃkha-ra-xū tsî ǃhae-bē du o, o tsa-ra-ba ǂai-de xu ǀom ǁnâ.’
English: Jehovah, this is the day; Now from our hearts, we want to pray. How you have honored us, favored us, More than words can say! Upon our labor of love, We’ve seen your blessing from above. And now a building stands, by our hands, As the proof thereof. (CHORUS) Jehovah God, it was a priv’lege For us to build this place for you. May we continue in your service throughout our days And bring you praise in all we do.

Damara: ǁNān sa-do ra ǃkhō-ǃoan ǁÎ-ba ra ǃkhō-ǃoa, ǁîn ǂgao-ban ga ǁkho-wa-am o. Nēs ge ǁîn mû-ǂui-sa ǀam-o ûib di-sa în si-da ǀkha ǀgui-ba ǃoa-ba ǁkhā. Tsî tā ǂâi-ǂhan-sen re ǃhoa du nî xūn xa, Je-ho-vab ge ǁkhā-si-ba nî mā. Sa-du di ǃgâi tsî tsau-ra ǃe-re-am-di ge tsau-ra khoe-na nî-ra tsâ-ǀkhā.
English: What happy faces we see, And what good friends we’ve come to be! And how we’ll cherish these memories For eternity! We saw your spirit, O Lord, In how we worked with one accord. And how we’ve added fame to your name; What a grand reward! (CHORUS) Jehovah God, it was a priv’lege For us to build this place for you. May we continue in your service throughout our days And bring you praise in all we do.

Damara: E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge ǁÎb di ǀgôab ǃna-ga. ǁGâu-ab ta mâ-ǃoa da tsâ, xa-we da ǀgui-ba mâ. ǂHau-ǃnâ-se da ra ǃoa-ba, khoen ǀkha ǃhoas ǃnâ-ū. ǀGai-sa-se da nî mâ ǁkhoa-ǂgao-sib hoab ǀkha. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge Xris-tub ǀkha ǀgui-ba. ǂKhîb ǀkha da ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǃKhūb ge ra ǂgae-ǂgui.”
English: Bless us as we meet together, O Jehovah, we now pray. We are thankful for our meetings; May your spirit with us stay.

Damara: E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge gū-na da ra ôa, ǁnān hî-na kā hân hoa-na tsî tsû-a-ǂgao hâ-na. ǁÎ-na da ôa tsî ra hui ǂgui ǃnā-di ǃnâ-ū da ra hoa-ǁae ǁkhau nî. ǃOa-ba ǃkhai-ba ǃoa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge Xris-tub ǀkha ǀgui-ba. ǂKhîb ǀkha da ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǃKhūb ge ra ǂgae-ǂgui.”
English: Help us, Lord, refine our worship; With your Word, oh, do us fill. Train our minds and tongues to witness; Love within our hearts instill.

Damara: E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge Xris-tub ǂgae-ǂguis ǃnâ. ǂHo-mi-sa da a nēs ǃgao. Hoa da nî-ra mâ-ǀgai. Tsî da ǂkhai-ka-ri nî hâ hoa-ǁae ǀams kō-se. ǁGâi-ǀāb ga hā xa-we da nî mâ-ǀgai hō. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ǃoa-ba-ao da ge Xris-tub ǀkha ǀgui-ba. ǂKhîb ǀkha da ra ao-ǁnâ: “ǃKhūb ge ra ǂgae-ǂgui.”
English: Loving Father, bless our meetings; Grant us peace and unity. May our words and may our actions Magnify your Sov’reignty.

Damara: ǁAeb ge hâ i, Xris-te-ǁîn di ûi ǀgau-ba da ge ǀū ī-sa. Xa-web ge ǃKhū-ba ǃnâ-ba ge sî ǁîb gao-sib a-mab xa. Nēs ǃnâ-ū da ge E-lob di ǂâi-sa ge mû tsî ǁÎb ǂgae-ǂguis. Tsî da ge Je-ho-vab di ǃa-nu ǀon-sa nî-ra ǀga-pi-ǀga-pi. Om-sa xu oms ǀkha da ǀhao-ū da ra khoen ǀkha nēs xa ra ǃhoa. ǁKhā-ǁkhā nî da ge ra în mû a-mab ra ǃno-ra kai ǃkhai-sa. Gao-sib a-mab xa da hoa ǃhao-di ǃnâ ǂan-ǂan tsî nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā. Tsî da ǃKhū-ba ǀgui-ba nî ǃoa-ba nē sî-sen-ni nî ǀams kō-se.
English: Jehovah, our Father, we want to express How grateful we are that your Word we possess! All Scripture is inspired; its truth has set us free. Its light gives us knowledge; the truth we can see.

Damara: Nēs ge a ǂkhîb tsî dans di ǁnae-tsa-na-sa hî-na Je-ho-va-ba ra kai-kai-sa. Nē mî-di khoe-na ra ǂgom-ǂgom-sa kai. Hā re da ǁnae, gao-si-ba koas ǃnâ-ū: (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhū-ba koa re ǁîb trons ai-ǃâ. ǁÎb di ǀgôab a Gao-ao xui-ao! ǁKhā-ǁkhā-sen re nē Gao-sib ǁnae-tsa-na-sa; ǃKhū-ba ǃoa kō tsî ǁîb ǀon-sa koa re.
English: Your Word has the power to reach deep inside. Our thoughts and intentions, it helps to divide. Your laws are clear and perfect, your judgments ever true. Your principles guide us in all that we do.

Damara: Nē ǁnae-tsa-nas ǀkha Gao-sib xa ao-ǁnâ re. Je-sub ge ǃhūb-aib ǂam-ai ra ǂgae-ǂgui. Tsîs ge ǀa-sa ǃhao-sa ge a ǂnu-bi-he, ǁÎb ǂgae-ǂgui-sa ra ǁkho-re-ǁha-re sa: (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhū-ba koa re ǁîb trons ai-ǃâ. ǁÎb di ǀgôab a Gao-ao xui-ao! ǁKhā-ǁkhā-sen re nē Gao-sib ǁnae-tsa-na-sa; ǃKhū-ba ǃoa kō tsî ǁîb ǀon-sa koa re.
English: Your Word, O Jehovah, has human appeal. Your prophets were like us; they felt what we feel. Please help us build a strong faith that follows what is heard. We thank you, Jehovah, for your precious Word!

Damara: Nē Gao-sib ams ge tsau-ran xa nî ǁnae-he. Nē hai-si-ams ge ǃam-ku tsî ǃgā-sa. ǂGuin ge nî-ra nē ǁnae-am-sa ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen tsîn ge khoe-na ǁkhau tsî nî mî-ba nî: (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhū-ba koa re ǁîb trons ai-ǃâ. ǁÎb di ǀgôab a Gao-ao xui-ao! ǁKhā-ǁkhā-sen re nē Gao-sib ǁnae-tsa-na-sa; ǃKhū-ba ǃoa kō tsî ǁîb ǀon-sa koa re.
English: The prophets of old sought to learn of the Christ, The hope of all groaning creation. God’s spirit revealed that Messiah would come, Providing the means of salvation. The time has arrived, the Messiah now reigns, The proof of his presence is clear. How great is the favor of learning such things; Into these even angels would peer! (CHORUS) Our path now becomes ever brighter; We walk in the full light of day. Behold what our God is revealing; He guides us each step of the way.

Damara: Nē-tsēn ge khoe-na Je-ho-vab di ǃa-nu ǀon-sa ra ǃkhā-ǃkhā. ǀNîn ta mî E-lob a ǁgai di. Tsî gâ-reb ta mî ‘ǀkhaib a di.’ Ham-e ǁÎb ǀon-sa nî ǁkhau-ba? Ham-e ǁÎb koa-sa nî ǁnâu kai? (
English: Our Lord has appointed a trustworthy slave, Through whom He gives food in due season. The light of the truth has grown brighter with time, Appealing to heart and to reason. Our path ever clearer, our steps ever firm, We walk in the brightness of day. All thanks to Jehovah, the Source of all truth, We most gratefully walk in his way. (CHORUS) Our path now becomes ever brighter; We walk in the full light of day. Behold what our God is revealing; He guides us each step of the way.

Damara: ǁNAEǀHAOS) ‘ǃKhū nē ta a! Sî te, sî te! Sa-du koas xa ta nî-ra ǁnae. Nēs xa kai xū-i a ǀkhai, ti ǃKhū. Nē ta a! Sî te, sî te!’
English: Life depends on Jehovah’s Word, All the things he has said. We must live not on bread alone; Live by his Word instead. Even now we have peace and joy, Future blessings assured. (CHORUS) Man must live not on bread alone; Life depends on God’s Word. There we find what we daily need; Life depends on God’s Word.

Damara: ǀNîn ta mî E-lob a ǂau ti, E-lo-ba ǃao-san ge a ǀū. ǀNîn ǁgôa-e-lo-ga ra ǃoa-ba. ǀNîn Gao-ga ǃKhūb trons ai ra ǂnûi. Ham-e khoe-na nî-ra mî-ba? Ham-e ǃKhūb ǃkhams xa nî ǃkhâi nî?  (
English: True accounts in God’s written Word Tell about those of old. Men and women who walked in faith— They were loyal and bold. We’re encouraged each time we read All they did and endured. (CHORUS) Man must live not on bread alone; Life depends on God’s Word. There we find what we daily need; Life depends on God’s Word.

Damara: ǁNAEǀHAOS) ‘ǃKhū nē ta a! Sî te, sî te! ǃAo ta-ma-se ta nî ǃkhâi nî. Nēs xa kai xū-i a ǀkhai, ti ǃKhū. Nē ta a! Sî te, sî te!’
English: Day by day as we read God’s Word, He gives comfort and hope. When the trials of life arise, He gives wisdom to cope. May we treasure within our heart All we’ve read and we’ve heard. (CHORUS) Man must live not on bread alone; Life depends on God’s Word. There we find what we daily need; Life depends on God’s Word.

Damara: Nē-tsēn khoe-na ra tsû-a-ǂgao ǁgai xūn kai-se ǂgui a-ma-ga. ǂHau-ǃnâ ǂgaob ǀkha da ra ôa nî a-mab ta ǂkhî-ba mā xui-ao. Ham-e nē khoe-na nî ǁkhae-ǂgao? Ham-e nî huin ǃgâi-ba ôa-sa? (
English: Myriads on myriads of brothers, Millions for all to see, Each one a faithful witness, Firm in integrity. Myriads we are on myriads, Growing, a mighty crowd, From ev’ry nation and tribe and tongue, We praise our God aloud.

Damara: ǁNAEǀHAOS) ‘ǃKhū nē ta a! Sî te, sî te! ǃGam-ǃgam-sen ra-na ta nî hui. Nēs xa kai xū-i a ǀkhai, ti ǃKhū. Nē ta a! Sî te, sî te!’
English: Myriads on myriads of brothers, We preach both far and near “Good news of something better,” Which millions long to hear. And as we keep on preaching, Though we at times are stressed, Jesus refreshes the weary souls; He gives us peace and rest.

Damara: Nē-sa ma-ti ra tsâ ôa-sa-se du ra ǃhoa o, Sa-du ǃâ-sa dīs ǃnâ-ū khoen ǂgao-ga tsâ-ǀkhās ǀkha? ǁKhā du an hoa-na dī, E-lob ge nau-na nî dī. ǂHau-ǃnâ ǂgao-gab ge a ǂan— ǁÎb di-nab ge a ǂan. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge kai-se ra dâ kai da, ǂgaob tsî ǂâis tsîn ǀkha da nî ǁnae. Hā re î da ao-ǁnâ hoa-ǁae, tsē-sa xu tsēs kō-se.
English: Myriads on myriads of brothers, God keeps us in his sight, Safe in his earthly courtyards, Serving him day and night. Myriads we are on myriads, With Kingdom news we go, God’s fellow workers we have become, Serving him here below.

Damara: Nē-sa ma-ti ra tsâ Khoen ga ǀkho-ma-sa ǁnâu o, ǃgâi ǂgao-ba ū-hâ khoe-na ǀam-o ûi-ba hōs ǃgao? ǀNî khoen ge ǃgâ ti-de, ǀnîn ge nî ǂgae-ǂha-pu-e. ǁÎb ǀon-sa tan-is a ǃgâi. ǀÛs o-se da nî ǃhoa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge kai-se ra dâ kai da, ǂgaob tsî ǂâis tsîn ǀkha da nî ǁnae. Hā re î da ao-ǁnâ hoa-ǁae, tsē-sa xu tsēs kō-se.
English: From a world divided and cold, God has brought us into his fold. Unity and peace we possess, Bringing us happiness. Unity we cherish; Harmony is sweet. In God’s work there’s much to be done. He directs us now through his Son. May we serve obediently, Working in harmony.

Damara: Nē-sa ma-ti ra tsâ E-lob ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ da o, E-lob ra ǂgom-ǃgâ da o ao-ǁnâ sî-sen-ni ǀkha? ǁKhoa-se da ra ao-ǁnâ, khoe-xa-ǃnâ mî-de ǃhoas ǀkha. ǂHau-ǃnâ-na da ge ra ôa. Nē ao-ǁnâs ge nî ǀam. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nēs ge kai-se ra dâ kai da, ǂgaob tsî ǂâis tsîn ǀkha da nî ǁnae. Hā re î da ao-ǁnâ hoa-ǁae, tsē-sa xu tsēs kō-se.
English: As we pray to be of one mind, Always tender, loving, and kind, Love will grow and praise will increase, Giving us joy and peace. Peace is so refreshing, Bringing such delight. As we show true brotherly love, God will grant us peace from above. With his help, united we’ll be, Serving him endlessly.

Damara: Nē ǁaeb ǃnâ, nē ǁgai tsē-di ǃnâ, da ge ǃnâ-ba ra mû. So-res ǂgâs kha-mi nî ī-sa ǃhūb-aib ai ǀae nî hā. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃNâ-ba nē ǃhūb-aib ai si-da mîs ge a ǃgā-sa. Tu-rab ǀkha ra hā-sa— ǁGoas kha-mi ra ǃnâ-sa, khoen hoan nî mû ǁkhā-se ī— tsî ǃuis go ǀam.
English: Many are the weaknesses That we all possess. Still Jehovah cares for us, Loves us nonetheless. He is so merciful; His love, so powerful. May we show this kind of love, Help those in distress.

Damara: Hoa khoen ge a-ma-ba nî ǂan ǁaeb ra ǃgû-ī kha-mi. ǁÎ-na da ge hoa-ǁae nî hui hoa-ǁae nî ǀgo-re-ban. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃNâ-ba nē ǃhūb-aib ai si-da mîs ge a ǃgā-sa. Tu-rab ǀkha ra hā-sa— ǁGoas kha-mi ra ǃnâ-sa, khoen hoan nî mû ǁkhā-se ī— tsî ǃuis go ǀam.
English: Some at times are weak in faith, Strong though they appear. By our reassuring words, We can calm their fears. Weak ones to God belong; His spirit makes them strong. May we feel their pain and cares, Help them dry their tears.

Damara: ǁNān E-lob-mî-sa ra ǁkhā-ǁkhān, ge kai ǂkhîb ǃnâ ra ǁhao. ǃKhō-ǃoa tsî da ra ǀa-ma xūn ge ǀgo-pe-ǀnō-he ǁoa. E-lob ǀGôa-ba da ge ra ǁgae ǁkhā-ǁkhāb ge-re ǀgaub ǃnâ. Tsî da ǁkhā-ǁkhā da ra-na ra hui în Je-ho-vab ǃoa ǀgū.
English: Rather than condemn the weak, We should bear in mind How much we can strengthen them By our being kind. May we be diligent, Give them encouragement. As we lend our kind support, Comfort they will find.

Damara: E-lob-mîs ǁkhā-ǁkhā-aon a-se, da ǃgâi-na ra dī-tsâ, în khoe-na ǂhau-ǃnâ-si-ba mû ǃKhū-ba da ra ǁgau-ba. E-lob-mî-sa da ra ôa-ǃnâ, Nē mîs ge ǃgâi-ǂhôa-sa. A da ǂgaob ǃgâi xū-na ǀgo-ra re î da ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen ǁkhā.
English: Sov’reign, Jehovah, merciful Father, Greater you are than our sinful hearts. Lighten our burden, soften our anguish, Give us the comfort your spirit imparts.

Damara: ǃKhūb ge ǂhâ da hâ-na ra mā ǁÎb mî-sa ǁkhā-ǁkhās ǃgao. Tsî hui-ba da ga ra ǂgan o, ob ge ra ǁnâu-am da. ǃKhūb mîs ǃnâ hâ xū-na da ǀnam; ǁÎb mîs a-ma ǃkhais ǃgao. ǁKhā-ǁkhā da ra khoe-na da a ǀnam, tsî nau-na nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā!
English: Father, we all fall short of your glory; Times there have been when we’ve lost our way. God, we implore you: Hear our petition. Give us your spirit to guide us each day.

Damara: Kai ǂkhîb ge Je-ho-vab gū-na ǁkhā-ǁkhā tsî mû ǁîn ǂkhî ǀgau-sa. ǁÎ-na ǃgâi ǀgaub ǃnâ ra dao-ǁgau-ba ǁÎb a-ma-ba ra ū-na. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-va ǁnâu-am da du re. To-xo-ba ǁî-na kō-ǃgâ re. Je-sub ǀons ǃnâ da ge ra ǂgan: Tsî ra ǀkho-ma; A-i mâ-i hoa-e mâ-hō.
English: When we are weary, weak, or discouraged, Your active force will our hearts renew. Give us the strength to soar like the eagles; May we receive holy spirit from you.

Damara: Tsēs hoa-sa da ge ra ǀgo-re-ban, ǁÎn ǂgoms ga ǃâi-tsâ-he o. ǁÎ-na da ge ra hui tsî kō-ǃgâ; ǁÎn ra ǀgai tsî ra ǀkhae-he. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-va ǁnâu-am da du re. To-xo-ba ǁî-na kō-ǃgâ re. Je-sub ǀons ǃnâ da ge ra ǂgan: Tsî ra ǀkho-ma; A-i mâ-i hoa-e mâ-hō.
English: God is love, and he invites us: ‘Walk with me and love my way.’ When we love both God and neighbor, Gracious deeds will fill each day. Therein lies the key to living; Therein lies the life we seek. Christlike love will never fail us; Christlike love through us will speak.

Damara: An Hoa-na ǂgom-ǃgâ-si-ba ū-hâ, E-lob tsî ǁÎb ǀGôab tsîn ǃnâ. Hui nî re în mâ-ǀgai tsî ǁnâu-ǀnam, În ǀam-o ûi-ba hō-ǁkhā. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-va ǁnâu-am da du re. To-xo-ba ǁî-na kō-ǃgâ re. Je-sub ǀons ǃnâ da ge ra ǂgan: Tsî ra ǀkho-ma; A-i mâ-i hoa-e mâ-hō.
English: Love of truth moves us to action; Love of God moves us to love. When we fail he seeks to help us; By his strength we rise above. Love is pure and never jealous; Love is kind and bears all things. May we grow to love our brother; May we taste what true love brings.

Damara: ǃKhū-ba ǃoa-ba-sa da ra ǃgôa, ao-ǁnâs ai-ǂha-nub ge ǀga-pi. ǁAe-ba da tsēs hoa-sa ra ǁa-ma-ǂui, ǂgui khoe-na da ge nî-ra ôa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhūb mîs ge ra mî: ‘Tsâ î du mû— mû Je-ho-vab a ǃgâi-sa.’ E-lo-ba ǃaos ge ǀkhae-ba ra hau. ǁKhā da a-na da ra dī.
English: Never let resentment lead you; May it never take your hand. Look to God, and he will guide you; He will teach you these commands: Love of God and love of neighbor, Ev’rything that love should be. May we always show to others Godlike love, yes, tenderly.

Damara: ǀOa-sa-se ǃKhū-ba ra ǃoa-ban ge kai-se kai ǀkhae-ga ra hō. E-lob ai da ra ǂgom-ai-ǂnûi xui-ao. Hoa xūn ǀkha da a ǂkhî-ǂâi-xa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃKhūb mîs ge ra mî: ‘Tsâ î du mû— mû Je-ho-vab a ǃgâi-sa.’ E-lo-ba ǃaos ge ǀkhae-ba ra hau. ǁKhā da a-na da ra dī.
English: We humbly bow to our God in prayer, That all his qualities we may share. But most important of all those things Is love, which having his spirit brings. We may be talented, wise, or bold, But we are nothing if love grows cold. We pray for love that is warm and true, Revealed in all that we say and do.

Damara: ǂHu-mi-sen da ge ra, so-res ge go ǂoa-xa. ǀNai da ge daob ai mâ ǂom-xa ais ǀkha khâi tsî ra ǀgo-re. ǂKhî-xa ais ǀkha ta khoe-na ǀhao-ū tsî ra ǃhoa. ǀNîn ra mâ xa-we, ǀnîn ra ǃkha-ru, xa-we da ǀû ti-de. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nē dao-ba da ge ǁhûi; Je-ho-va-ba ûi-ba. ǁÎb ra mîn hoa-na da ge ra dī. Hoa-ǁae da nî mâ-hō, so-res tsî ǀna-nub ǃnâ. Nēb ge ǀgaub hî-na da ra mî-ba: ‘ǀNam du da.’
English: Love looks for ways to give graciously And thinks of others unselfishly. Love never harbors a hateful thought, Forgives our brothers, as Jesus taught. Love helps us patiently suffer wrong, Bears heavy loads when it’s really strong. Through ev’ry trial let love prevail; It bears all things; it will never fail.

Damara: Tsēs di ǀams go a ǀkhī, so-res ge go a ǂgâ. Tsau da hâ xa-we ta ge a ǂkhî, si-da ǂgaob ge ra dâ. Nē ûi-ba ta a ǀnam; ǁkhā-sib hoab ǀkha ta ǀnam. Tsî ǁÎ-ba nî gan-gan, kō-ǃgâ dab ra xui-ao, tsēs hoa-sa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nē dao-ba da ge ǁhûi; Je-ho-va-ba ûi-ba. ǁÎb ra mîn hoa-na da ge ra dī. Hoa-ǁae da nî mâ-hō, so-res tsî ǀna-nub ǃnâ. Nēb ge ǀgaub hî-na da ra mî-ba: ‘ǀNam du da.’
English: The pattern of love, we learn from Jehovah Shows the way, guides our way. In all he has done, his dealings have shown us How to display his loving way. He gave us his Son, his dearest possession To cover our sin, forgiving transgression. What proof of his love​—its greatest expression! His way is love, Yes, God’s way is love.

Damara: Je-sub ge ge a mî, î da ǃnâ-ba ǁgau. So-res ǀgo-ra-e dī ta-ma hâ kha-mi. Xoa-di ǃnâ-ū i ge, ǂkhî-ba ra ǁnâu-e. ǁÎb ǃnâ-ba da ǁgae ǃKhūb mî-sa ǁkhā-ǁkhās ǃnâ-ū.
English: When we walk his way, our love for each other Will be true, warm and true, Will move us to care for all of our brothers, Old ones and new, not just a few. True love for our God and love for our brother, We can’t have the one and not have the other. The faults of our friends, we readily cover, Proving our love, Our brotherly love.

Damara: Ab E-lob hai-si-am-sa khoe-na tsâ-ǀkhā. Ab ǃnâ re, ao-ǁnâs ǃnâ da ra ǁhao hî-na. Xoas ra hui da ǃgâi-ǂhôas xa da ga ǃhoa o. A-ma-ba da ge khoen hoan ǀkha ra ǀgo-ra-gu.
English: The pattern of love, the bond that unites us Lets us be family. Our Father above now warmly invites us: “Come taste and see real unity.” Come share in the love and joy that define us; God’s spirit and Word, he gives to refine us. Our brothers and friends are here to remind us, God’s way is love. Jehovah is love.

Damara: Khoe-xa-ǃnâ-sib nē ǃhūb-ai-ba ra ǃnâ kai. Tsî si-da mî-di ge ǂkhai-si-ba ra mā. Ab ǂKhai-si-ba ǃnâ ǀga-ra re ǃgâin hoan ǃnâ. O i si-da sî-sen-ga ǃKhū-ba nî ǂkhî-ǂkhî.
English: Loyal love! God is love. We can sense his care from above. God by means of his precious Son Paid the ransom for ev’ryone, Giving hope that we might possess Life eternal and happiness. (CHORUS) Hey there, all you thirsty ones, Come and drink life’s water free. Yes, come drink, you thirsty ones; God’s loyal love you’ll see.

Damara: Om-sa xu oms ǀkha ǃgan-gu ǃnâ, da E-lob xa ra ǃhoa. Kai-ǃā-sa xu ǃga-ro-ǃās ǃoa, da ǃKhūb gū-na ra ôa. ǃGâi-ǂhôas E-lob gao-sib ǂgae-ǂguis, di kē-bo-e hâs ge ǃhū-baib hoab ǃnâ ra ao-ǁnâ-he Kain tsî ǂkham an hoan xa.
English: Loyal love! God is love. All his works give proof of his love. Love Jehovah has further shown, Giving Jesus the kingly throne. God’s own purpose has come to pass. See! His Kingdom is here at last! (CHORUS) Hey there, all you thirsty ones, Come and drink life’s water free. Yes, come drink, you thirsty ones; God’s loyal love you’ll see.

Damara: Om-sa xu oms ǀkha ǃgan-gu ǃnâ, da o-res xa ra !hoa. Tsî ǁnān ū-ǃoa tsî ra mî-ǁguin E-lo-ba ǃoa-ba-sa. Ma-tin ǁÎb ǀon-sa nî-ra ǃgôa ǁÎ-ban a ǀū hî-na? Mâ oms hoas tsî ǃgan-gu ǃnâ da ge ǀon-sa nî ǂan-ǂan.
English: Loyal love! God is love. May his spirit move us to love. As we loyally help the meek, God’s commandments they learn to keep. We are serving with godly fear, Preaching boldly for all to hear. (CHORUS) Hey there, all you thirsty ones, Come and drink life’s water free. Yes, come drink, you thirsty ones; God’s loyal love you’ll see.

Damara: Hā î da om-sa xu oms ǀkha Gao-sib xa ao-ǁnâ re. Ū-ǃoa ta-man ga ī xa-we, da khoe-na ra ǁhûi kai. Je-ho-vab xa ǂan-ǂan nî-sa tsî ǁîb di a-mab xa. Om-sa xu oms ǀkha da ga ǃgû, o da khoe-na ra hō.
English: When our love is pure and intense, We make Jehovah’s heart rejoice. Love is his greatest quality, Something that we hold dear. Warm affection glows in our hearts, Making a loyal friendship grow. Love always acts unselfishly, Proving our love sincere. When we see a friend in need, We’ll be there to lend a helping hand. Truly we can be a friend, Someone who can understand. Jesus showed what love really means, Helping us see Jehovah’s love, Touching our hearts and moving us. Tender feelings are a start. Love intensely from the heart.

Damara: E-lob ge si-da ǂhâ-ga ǂan. ǂKhîb tsî ǃgâi-ǃōb tsî-kha ra mā. ǁÎb ge ǂgui ǀgau-ga ra ǁgau da. ǁÎ-ba ǃoa-ba ǁkhās ǃa-ro-ma. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Dī-tsâ re, ǁgū-tsâ-sa, ǁÎ-ba ǃoa-ba-sa. ǂHâ-sib ga ra hâ o, o hui re. ǀNam-mi ǃnâ mâ-ǀgai.
English: Signs of the times are pointing to the Kingdom. Good news we tell for all to hear. Lift up your heads, and look to your salvation; Time for deliverance is near! (CHORUS) The joy of Jehovah is our stronghold. Sing loud, and raise a joyful cry. Rejoice in the hope, and show a grateful heart, All give praise and laud our God on high. The joy of Jehovah is our stronghold. His greatness all must come to know. With constant devotion to our God and King, Godly joy in service we will show.

Damara: Ao-ǁnâ da ge nî ǀūs o-se. ǂHâ-sib ga hâ, o da ra hui. ǀNam-ma da ra ǁgau dī-tsâs ǀkha. Nē-sa da ge hoa-ǁae ra dī. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Dī-tsâ re, ǁgū-tsâ-sa, ǁÎ-ba ǃoa-ba-sa. ǂHâ-sib ga ra hâ o, o hui re. ǀNam-mi ǃnâ mâ-ǀgai.
English: Look to our God, you lovers of Jehovah. No need to fear, for he is strong. Stand up and shout with voices loud as thunder; Sing to our God a joyful song! (CHORUS) The joy of Jehovah is our stronghold. Sing loud, and raise a joyful cry. Rejoice in the hope, and show a grateful heart, All give praise and laud our God on high. The joy of Jehovah is our stronghold. His greatness all must come to know. With constant devotion to our God and King, Godly joy in service we will show.

Damara: ǃĀ-ro-di tsî ǃhū-gu ǃnâ da ge ǀgo-re-ǀî om-ga ra om. Tsî ǀnî hâ go-wa-ga ra ǂan tsî a-ma-ba nî-ra ao-ǁnâ. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Dī-tsâ re, ǁgū-tsâ-sa, ǁÎ-ba ǃoa-ba-sa. ǂHâ-sib ga ra hâ o, o hui re. ǀNam-mi ǃnâ mâ-ǀgai.
English: Our reasons for joy are abundant, Like riches increasing in worth. Those precious to God from all nations Are joining us in all the earth. The joy in our heart is well-founded, With roots reaching deep in God’s Word. We daily partake of its teachings; Faith follows the things we have heard. Our causes for joy are deep-seated, Like embers that burn in our hearts. Though troubles and trials beset us, Endurance Jehovah imparts. (CHORUS) Jehovah our God is our joy, The work of his hands our delight. How deep are his thoughts, how great are his works, Abounding in goodness and might!

Damara: ǁKho-re-ǁha-re nē-tsē nē-ba hâ-na. În mî-sa ǁnâu tsî ū-ba-sen ǁkhā. Ûi-ba ū-hâ a-ma-bab ge ra mā. ǂKhî-ǂkhî-xa ǂgao-gu ǀkha da ra ǃe-re-am bi.
English: We gladly behold his productions, The heavens, the sea, and the land. We gaze at the book of creation, Applauding the work of his hands. Triumphantly we now bear witness, Proclaiming the Kingdom of God. The news of its birth and its blessings, We joyously spread all abroad. Eternal rejoicing approaches, Like daylight that follows the night. The promised new earth and new heavens Will bring everlasting delight. (CHORUS) Jehovah our God is our joy, The work of his hands our delight. How deep are his thoughts, how great are his works, Abounding in goodness and might!

Damara: Gan-gans ǀhao-hâb ǃûi-ao-gu ǃgao E-lo, ǁkho-re-ǁha-re tsî-gu ra ǂkhî kai. ǁÎ-ga da ǀnam-ǀnam-sa-se ra kō-ǀî. Tsî nē-ba da ǀnî khoe-na ra ǁkho-re-ǁha-re.
English: Jehovah, God of love, You have promised us your peace. So we ask you for your spirit; May its fruitage yet increase. Our faith in your dear Son, Who is loyal, ever true, Gives us access to your friendship; We are now at peace with you.

Damara: E-lob ǁkhau-ǂuis ge hoan xa ra ǁnâu-he, în ǂhau-ǃnâ khoe-na a-ma-ba hō. Je-ho-vab ge ǀGôab ǃnâ-ū ge ǂgae da. ǁNā-a-ma-ga ǁkho-re-ǁha-re-gu ǀgam-sa-se.
English: Your spirit aids our sight As your Word gives needed light. We are guided and protected In a world as dark as night. Until the time has come When all wars and terrors cease, May your spirit bless our efforts To maintain our godly peace.

Damara: Je-ho-vab xa ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen re. Ga-gab ra mî “ûib di ǁgam-e ū” re. ǀGai-ǀgai ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sab ǃKhū-ba ra mā. A-ma-ba ra ôan ge nî-ra hō bi.
English: You’ve gathered those you love, Both in heaven and on earth, We’re united by your spirit To proclaim the Kingdom’s birth. Your righteous Kingdom rule Soon will bring an end to war. Then the meek ones will delight to Live in peace forevermore.

Damara: Si-da ǀhao-de xu da ge ǁgoe-oa ta-ma hâ, ǃgâi xū-na da ǁnā-pa ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā-he. E-lob ga-gab tsî si-da ǃgâ-san ǀkha, da ra ǀgai-ǀgai-gu tsî ǃnâb ǃnâ mâ-ǀgai.
English: Praise Jehovah, God of peace, God of unity. He will make all wars to cease, Bring in harmony. Prince of Peace is Christ his Son, Tender, calm, and kind. When the fight for right he’s won, Perfect peace we’ll find.

Damara: ǁNae-tsa-na-de ǁnâus ge kai-se ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ da! ǁKhā-ǁkhā-he hân di nams ǀōb ge a ǃgâi! A da hoa-ǁae E-lob khoen ǀkha hâ ǀhao! A da hoa-ǁae ǁîn ǁae-gu hō-e re!
English: We have left off angry words, Making quarrels cease. We have made from spears and swords, Implements of peace. If this peace we want to keep, Then we must forgive. Peacefully as Jesus’ sheep, May we learn and live.

Damara: E-lo-xo-re-sa ǃhūb-aib ǃnâ da ge hâ, khoen ge E-lo-ba ǂan ta-ma. E-lob xa dao-ǁgau-he-sa da ge ǂhâ hâ. Ai-tsa-ma da a hui-sen ǁoa. Si-da ǀhao-di ge hoa-ǁae ra khoa-khoa da tsî ǃKhūb ai ra ǂgom-ai-ǂnûi kai. Tsî ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ da hoa-ǁae ǃgâi-na dīs ǀkha. Tsî ǁkhā-si-ba hoa da ra mā. Tā-tsē da ge nē-sa ǁnā-xū-ǃnâ ti-de. ǁÎb di ǂâi-sa da ra dī ǂgao. Si-da ǀhao-di ge ǃgâi ǀgaub ǃnâ ra dao-ǁgau tsî si-da ǂgom-sa ra ǀgai-ǀgai.
English: Peace from God gives proof to all; He has blessed our way. His commands we gladly keep, Ready to obey. We would recommend our way, Show our peaceful care Till the Kingdom’s perfect day Brings peace ev’rywhere.

Damara: E-lob ge si-da di ǂhâ-si-ga a ǂan ǁîb mî-mā-de da nî ǁnâu-ǀnam. Tsî tsēs hoa-sa ta ga ǀhao-de hâ ǃnâ o, os ge ǂgom-sa ǃKhūb ǃnâ nî ǀgai. E-lo-ǃao-ǃnâ-xa ao-gu ǃnâ-ū da ge ra mû taes a a-ma ǂgom-sa. Om-a-ri-de xu ta ra hō ǂkhâ-ǃnâ-di ge ra ǁgau khoen ǀkha da hâ-sa. Tsî ǃgâi ûi-ba da ra mû-ǂui ǁaeb ai da ge si-da ǃgâ-san ǀkha nî ǀhao. Si-da ǀhao-di ta-wa da ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sen ǂgom-sa da nî om-khâi ǀgau-sa.
English: Our Sov’reign Lord Jehovah Is zealous for his holy name. He fervently desires To clear it from unrighteous blame. Through many generations, Great endurance he has shown; In loving, kindly patience, Not weary has he grown. His will is that salvation All sorts of people might attain. Long-lasting, loving patience By God will not have been in vain.

Damara: Nē-ba da ge ǀhao hâ Je-ho-va E-lo. Sa-du ǁkhau-ǂui-sa da go ū-ǃoa. Sa-du mîs ge ti ǂai-ra ǃnâb a-se ī tsî E-lob ǁkhā-ǁkhās ge a ǃgao-ǃgao. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Sa-du ǀgau-ga ǁkhā-ǁkhā te î ta ǁnâu tsî Sa-du di mî-mā-de ǁnâu-ǃā ǁkhā. Hui te î ta ǃgâi-se a-mab ǃnâ ǃgû, tsî Sa-du ǂha-nu-ba ti ǃgao-ǃgao kai.
English: The quality of patience Will help us on our godly path. It lets our heart be tranquil, Protects us from unrighteous wrath. It finds the good in others, Always hoping for the best. It helps us keep our balance In times when we’re distressed. Along with other virtues That holy spirit can bestow, Our patience will assist us To imitate the God we know.

Damara: Je-ho-vab gā-ai-sib ge kai-se a kai. Sa-du ǀgo-ra-ǃgâ-di ge a ǃgâi. Sa-du mîs ge bu-ru-xa tsî ǀam ta-ma. Sa-du a-mab ge nî-ra hâ-hâ. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Sa-du ǀgau-ga ǁkhā-ǁkhā te î ta ǁnâu tsî Sa-du di mî-mā-de ǁnâu-ǃā ǁkhā. Hui te î ta ǃgâi-se a-mab ǃnâ ǃgû, tsî Sa-du ǂha-nu-ba ti ǃgao-ǃgao kai.
English: Great God, Jehovah, boundless in might, You have made known your love of right. Badness prevails on earth below, Causing us pain, as you well know. You are not slow, as men may contend; Your time is near for patience to end. (CHORUS) We look ahead with hope renewed, Praising your name in deep gratitude.

Damara: Xris-tu-ba da ga ǃgâ o, ǁgau i da ra? ǁÎb di ǁkhā-ǁkhās ge dao-ba ra ǁgau da. ǁÎs xa ǁnâu tsî ǂans ge hoa-ǁae ra ǂkhî kai, ǂan tsî da ga ǁnâu-ǀnam o, ob ta ǀkhae. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃGâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re, ǃKhūb ǂâi-sa du ga ǁnâu o. ǂKhî tsî ǁîb sâb ǃnâ du ga ǂgā ǂgao o, ǃgâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re.
English: One thousand years, from your point of view, Are like a day when they are through. Time now proceeds to your great day; It will arrive without delay. Though all transgression you do resent, Your heart is glad when sinners repent. (CHORUS) We look ahead with hope renewed, Praising your name in deep gratitude.

Damara: Si-da ûib ge oms kha-mi ra ǁkhau-ba da ǃgâi-ses ga ra om-he tsî mâ-ǀgai o. Je-sub ǀnam-ǀnam-sa mî-de da ga sao o, ob ge si-da ûi-ba ǃgaos ai nî mâ. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃGâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re, ǃKhūb ǂâi-sa du ga ǁnâu o. ǂKhî tsî ǁîb sâb ǃnâ du ga ǂgā ǂgao o, ǃgâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re.
English: We praise you, Jehovah, deep from our hearts, For in your Word we find Your power supreme, your wisdom so great, And yet you are loving and kind.

Damara: ǁGam-mi xa ǃgam ǃno-ma-ga ū-hâ hais ta ǂû-na mâ-ǁaeb hoa-ba ǀkhī-ū kha-mi, da ga Je-ho-va-ba ga ra ǁnâu-ǀnam o, o da ǀam-o ûib ǀkha nî-ra ǀkhae-he. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) ǃGâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re, ǃKhūb ǂâi-sa du ga ǁnâu o. ǂKhî tsî ǁîb sâb ǃnâ du ga ǂgā ǂgao o, ǃgâ, ǁnâu-ǀnam tsî ǀkhae-he re.
English: Your Son still invites those bruised by the world To leave their cares behind. How kindly his yoke, how tender his heart, He’s always refreshing and kind.

Damara: A da ǂkhâ-ǃnâ-gu da ra kha-mi E-lo-ba ǂhau-ǃnâ-se ǃoa-ba, ǀnam-mi ǁnā ǀgaus ai ra ǀgai-ǀgai-he. ǃGâi sî-sen-gu ǂkhî-ba ra hau. E-lob di khoen ǁae-gu hâ ǀnam-mi ge ǁkhae-ǂgao-si-ba ra mā da. Si-da di ǀhao-hâb ge sâu-ǃkhai-ba, si-da ǁa-po-sa sâu ǃkhaib ge.
English: We see in our God and Jesus our Lord, The persons we should be. The power of kindness we can possess. With kindness, how strong we can be!

Damara: ǃGâi ǁaeb ai ra ǃhoa-e mî-de ǁnâus ge kai-se ra ǁkhae-ǂgao kai da! Nē ǁkhae-ǂgaos mî-de ǁnâus ge ra hui ǂgom-ǂgom-sa ǃgâi ǀhō-sa-na xu. ǀGui-ba sî-sen-ǀhaos ge kai-se ǃgâi ǁîn ǃâu-ba-sen-sa ū-hân ǀkha! ǀGai-ǀgai-gus ǀgau-ga da ra ôa-am î da hui-gu ǃgom ǁae-gu ǃnâ.
English: O Jehovah, God of goodness, You have blessed us all our days! You are holy, ever loyal, And so good in all your ways. You show favor, granting mercy, Far beyond what we deserve. You’re so worthy of our worship, And it’s you we gladly serve.

Damara: Si-da ǂgoms mû-di ǀkha da ra mû Je-ho-vab tsēs go ǀgū ǃkhai-sa. Si-da ǀhû-ǀhao-de da ge ǂhâ hâ î da nē daob ǃnâ ǃgû ǀga-ra. ǀGui-ǃnâ-xa-se Je-ho-vab khoen ǀkha, da ge E-lo-ba nî ǃoa-ba. ǁNā-a-ma-ga da ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ-gu î da ǂgom-ǂgom-sa-se mâ-ǀgai.
English: Your own goodness is reflected In the people whom you choose; And the proof is in their conduct And the preaching of good news. Your good teaching, your good shepherds, Bear good fruit in many lands. May you grant us holy spirit, And may goodness guide our hands.

Damara: Je-ho-va nēs ge tsē-sa; ǂgao-ga xu da ge ra ǀgo-re. Sa-du ǃgôa tsî ra kō-ǃgâ da ǀgaub, mî-di a ǁgau ǁoabǃ ǀNam-mi di sî-sen-gu ai, da ge sa-du ǀkhae-ba ge mû. Tsî ge om-ma mā, ǃkhūb ǁkhā-sib ǀkha nēs ǀnam-ma ra ǁgau. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-va nēb a kai ai-ǂha-nu, Sa-du ǃoa-ba ǃkhai-sa om-sa. A da Sa-du di ǃoa-ba ǃkhais ǃnâ hâ ǀga-ra re tsî dī da ran ǃnâ koa du re.
English: May you bless our deeds of goodness To our brothers, great or small. May we show them special favor As we work at good t’ward all. In each fam’ly, congregation, In each town and neighborhood, With your blessing and your spirit, May we be a force for good.

Damara: ǂKhî ai-de da ge ra mû tsî da ge ra ǃgâi ǀho-sa kai! Ī ge xū-na da ge nî ǃgôa-ǃgâ, ǀam-o-sib kō-se! Sa-du ge nî kō-ǃâ da, ǀGui-ba da ra ǃgû ǀgaub ǃnâ ǃKhū. Tsî da sa-du ǀon-sa ra ǃgôa-ǃgâ nēb ge kai ǀkhae-ba! (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-va nēb a kai ai-ǂha-nu, Sa-du ǃoa-ba ǃkhai-sa om-sa. A da Sa-du di ǃoa-ba ǃkhais ǃnâ hâ ǀga-ra re tsî dī da ran ǃnâ koa du re.
English: Because we are imperfect, O Jehovah, The inclination of our heart is flawed. There is a sin that easily ensnares us— A lack of faith in you, the living God. (CHORUS) Give us more faith, we beg of you, Jehovah. Please help us out according to our need. Give us more faith, according to your mercy, That we may honor you in word and deed.

Damara: Je-ho-va-ba koas ge kai-se ǃgâi tsî ǁîb ǀons ǃgao ǃkhai-e om-sa! Nē-sa da dâb ǀkha ra dī nē-si ǁÎb ǂkhai-si-ba ǂan-ǂans ǃnâ-ū. Mâ xū-i hoa-e da ra mā du. Hoan Sa-du di tsoa-tsoa-sa xu. Si-da ǁkhā-sib tsî ū da hâ xūn, hoa-na da ǂgao-ba xu ra mā. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nē ǃkhai-ba da sa-do ra mā, Sa-du ǀon-sa ū-hâ-ba. Nē ǃkhai-ba da ge ra mā du; to-xo-ba ū-ǃoa bi re.
English: Apart from faith, no one can fully please you. We must believe our faith will be repaid. And as a shield, our faith provides a refuge. We face the future firm and unafraid. (CHORUS) Give us more faith, we beg of you, Jehovah. Please help us out according to our need. Give us more faith, according to your mercy, That we may honor you in word and deed.

Damara: Nē-si da nî ǃgôa du si-da ǁGû, sa-do nē-ba koa-sa mā-sa. As Sa-du koa-sa ǂkhai-se ī re, sa-du dao-ǁgau-sa ra saon ǃgao. Nē ǃkhai-ba da ǃoa-bas ǃgao ū-hâ, tsî da nî ǃgâi-se kō-ǃgâ bi. Tsî âb ǀha-pe-se mâ ǃkhō-ams ǃgao, si-da hai-si-am-sa huis ǃgao. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Nē ǃkhai-ba da sa-do ra mā, Sa-du ǀon-sa ū-hâ-ba. Nē ǃkhai-ba da ge ra mā du; to-xo-ba ū-ǃoa bi re.
English: On many occasions God spoke to men By means of his prophets of old. Today he is saying, ‘Let all repent,’ By God’s own Son we are told. (CHORUS) Do we have strong faith? Is it real? We must build such faith to survive. Is our faith proved true by our works? By means of faith, we’ll be preserved alive.

Damara: ǀHû-ǀhao da ge go Je-ho-va, ǀkhae da re di da ra ǂgan. ǀHao-de da ra ǃgôa âb sa-du ga-ga-ba si-da ǀkha hâ.
English: We gladly obey Christ Jesus’ command To share Kingdom truth far and wide. We boldly declare God’s message of hope; His promise we’ll never hide. (CHORUS) Do we have strong faith? Is it real? We must build such faith to survive. Is our faith proved true by our works? By means of faith, we’ll be preserved alive.

Damara: Hui da si-da ǃoa-ba-sa ǃgâi-ǃgâis ǀkha; Sa-du mîs ǃnâ-ū. ǁKhā-ǁkhā da î da ao-ǁnâ ǁkhā tsî ǀnam-ma ǂgaob ǃnâ ū-hâ.
English: Our faith is an anchor firm and secure; We never will shrink back in fear. Our trust in Jehovah helps us endure; We know salvation is near. (CHORUS) Do we have strong faith? Is it real? We must build such faith to survive. Is our faith proved true by our works? By means of faith, we’ll be preserved alive.

Damara: ǀKhae si-da ǀhao-de ǀnam-xa-ǃnâ ǁGû tsî ǂkhî-ba mā da re. Si-da mî-di tsî dīb Sa-du ǂgae-ǂgui-sa ra ǀga-pi kai.
English: The greatest of men was our Lord Jesus Christ; By pride or ambition, he was not enticed. God’s purpose gave Jesus the prominent role; Yet, lowly in heart, he was always whole-souled.

Damara: Je-ho-va si-da ǁGû mî-ba du ǂgao da ge ra sa-du mî-sa da ra ǃgôa-ǃgâ-sa! E-lob-mîs ge sa-do xu hâ tsî ra ǃno-ra kai; ǁîs ǂan-sa ra mā î da a-ma-ba mû.
English: To all who are toiling with troublesome cares, He offers to carry the burdens they bear. Refreshment they find as the Kingdom they seek. With kindness and mildness, he favors the meek.

Damara: Sa-du mîs ge ǂgao-ba ǃgam-se ra tsâ-ǀkhā. ǁÎs ge si-da ǂâi-de ǀgo-res ǀkha ra hui. Sa-du ǂha-nu-gu ǃgâi tsî ǀgo-ra-ǃgâ-de ǃam-ku. Sa-du mîs ge hoa xūn ǃnâ ra dao-ǁgau da.
English: ‘We all are just brothers,’ our Lord Jesus said. In humble submission, we look to our Head. The mild and the meek ones to God have great worth; He promises they will inherit the earth.

Damara: Je-ho-vab mîs ge khoe da ǃnâ ra sî-sen. Kē-bo-aon ǀoa-sa ta-ma si-da kha-mi. To-xo-ba hui da re î da ǀgai-sa ǂgom-sa om. Sa-du mî-sa da ra ǃgôa-ǃgâ Je-ho-va!
English: We love Jehovah with heart, mind, and soul; But since we are sinful, we need self-control. Fleshly desires bring trouble and strife; Living by spirit brings peace and life.

Damara: Kē-bo-ao-gu ge Xris-tub xa ge ǂan i, ku-ru-sa-ben di ǃâu-ba-sen-na. ǃKhūb ga-gab ge Me-siab hā-sa ge kē-bo, ǁîb ǃnâ-ū da ge o-re-sa hō. ǁAeb ge go hā, Me-siab ge nî-ra ǂgae-ǂgui, ǁÎb hās ge nē-si a ǃgā-sa. Nē xūn xa ǁkhā-ǁkhā-sens ge kai-se a ǃgâi. ǀHom-ǃgā-gu tsîn nē-na ra ôa-ǃnâ! (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Si-da daob ge kai-se a ǃgā-sa. Tsē-a da ge ǃnâb ǃnâ ra ǃgû. Ôa-ǃnâ E-lob ra ǁgau da xūn xa ǁîb ge hoa-ǁae ra dao-ǁgau da.
English: Satan’s temptations confront us each day, And sin’s law within us can lead us astray. Power of truth is greater than sin. Thanks to Jehovah, our minds can win.

Damara: ǃKhūb ge ǂgom-ǂgom-sa ǃgā-ba ge ǁgau-mâi ǁaeb ai ga-ga-si ǂû-e ra mā-ba. A-mab ǃnâb ǁaeb ǀkha ǃgā-sas ǀgui-sa ra dī tsî ǂgaob ai sî-sen-ǂui-ba ū-hâ. Nē daob ge a ǃgā-sa tsî a ǁa-po-sa. Tsî da ǃKhūb dao-ǁgaus ǃnâ ra ǃgû. ǃKhū-ba da ra koa a-mab di ǃgao-ǃgao-ba tsî da ǁÎb daob ǃnâ nî hâ ǀga-ra. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Si-da daob ge kai-se a ǃgā-sa. Tsē-a da ge ǃnâb ǃnâ ra ǃgû. Ôa-ǃnâ E-lob ra ǁgau da xūn xa ǁîb ge hoa-ǁae ra dao-ǁgau da.
English: Each word and action reflects on God’s name, So we must endeavor to keep free from blame. In all we do, we make this our goal: Always maintaining our self-control.

Damara: ǂKha-nis ge hâ ǁîs di ǂgui ǂha-we-ga xu ǂkhîb tsî ǃâu-ba-sen-sa ra mā da-sa. ǁÎs bu-ru-xa mî-di ge ǀgai-ba ū-hâ tsî “ǁō” hâ khoen hoa-na ûi-ba nî mā. Nē ǂkha-nis ge E-lob ǀkhae-ba khoen ǃoa-gu. Tsî ǃKhūb di dao-ǁgaus ǃna-ga ge xoa-he, khoe-gu hî-na E-lo-ba a ǀnam gu xa tsî gu ǃA-nu ga-gab xa ge hui-he.
English: Nations are troubled as never before. People are fearful of what lies in store. Firm and immovable we need to be, Serving our God faithfully. (CHORUS) Steadfast we all need to be; Far from this world we keep free, Standing firm to the end, Unending life we’ll see.

Damara: ǁÎ-gu ge E-lob di ku-rus xa ge xoa, ma-tib ge ǁÎb ǀgai-ba sî-sen-ū-sa. Tsî ma-tin ge khoe-na ǁo-re o ī ǀgaub tsî pa-ra-dais ge ǂoa-ǃnâ-he ǀgau-sa. ǁÎ-gu tsîn ge ǀgui ǀhom-ǃgāb xa ge a xoa Je-ho-vab ǂgae-ǂgui-sa ge a mâ-ǃoa-ba. Tsî ǁnās ge khoen ǃgom-si-ga ge ǃa-ro-ma, xa-we ǃKhūb ge nē-sa nî dī-u-nu.
English: Snares of the world and temptations abound. We can resist if our thinking is sound. Hating what’s bad while we love what is true Makes us immovable too. (CHORUS) Steadfast we all need to be; Far from this world we keep free, Standing firm to the end, Unending life we’ll see.

Damara: Tsî ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob di ǁaeb ge nē-si go hā: ǃKhūb ǂgae-ǂgui-sa ǁÎb ǂkhau-he-sab ǃnâ-ū. Tsî da ge Gao-sib ǃgâi-ǂhôa-sa ra ao-ǁnâ tsî da ǁÎb di ǀkhae-gu xa nî-ra ǃhoa. E-lob-mîs ǃnâ da nē xūn xa ra khom-ai, nēs ge kai-se ǀō-ai-sa ǂkha-ni-sa. Nē ǂkha-nis ge khoe-na kai ǂkhî-ba ra mā. Nē ǂkha-ni-sa da hoa da khom-ai re.
English: Give to God worship that comes from the heart. In the Lord’s service may we have a part. Preach the good news, always holding it fast. Soon the last days will have passed. (CHORUS) Steadfast we all need to be; Far from this world we keep free, Standing firm to the end, Unending life we’ll see.

Damara: !Khūb mîs si-da ǃnâ-ba ra mā tsî ǃkhae-nab ǃnâ ra hui da. ǂHau-ǃnâ-se da ga ra sao o, ob a-ma-ba ra ǃno-ra kai.
English: Ever loyal to Jehovah, Loyal love we wish to show. As a people, dedicated, His commands we want to know. His advice will never fail us, And his counsel we obey. He is loyal; we can trust him. From his side we’ll never stray.

Damara: Xoas hoas ge ǁÎ-ba xu ra hā tsî mî-sa ǂans ǀkha ra hui. ǃA-nu xoa-di ge ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ tsî hoa-ǁae ǁkhā-ǁkhās ǀkha ra hui.
English: Ever loyal to our brothers, Sticking close in times of need. Ever caring, always trusting, Ever kind in word and deed. We show honor to our brothers And respect them from the heart. Ever loyal, ever closer, From their side we’ll never part.

Damara: Nē mî-di E-lo-ba xu hâ tsî da ǁîb ǀnam-ma ra mû. ǁÎb mî-sa da ga khom-ai o, os ge ǁî-sa nî dao-ǁgau da.
English: Ever loyal to their guidance When our brothers lead the way. When they give us clear direction, May we loyally obey. Then the blessing from Jehovah Will be ours to make us strong. When we’re loyal, ever faithful, To Jehovah we’ll belong.

Damara: ǀOa-di-si ǀoa-di-si ǃgâ-san, ǂgui-na da ge ra mû. Mâ-i hoa-i a ǂhau-ǃnâ tsî ǂgom-ǂgom-sa-se mâ. ǀOa-di-si ǀoa-di-sis ǃnâ hân ge ǀgai-sa ǂnu-bi, hoa ǃhao-di tsî ǁae-di tsî-na xu, da ra E-lo-ba koa.
English: Our happy God is merciful, His mercy not just dutiful. He takes delight in kindly deeds And freely grants our daily needs. Repentant ones can be assured Their plea for mercy will be heard. Remembering that we are dust, He’s merciful and kind and just.

Damara: ǀOa-di-si ǀoa-di-si ǃgâ-san, hoa-ba da ra ao-ǁnâ. ‘ǃGâib xa ǃgâi ǂhôa-e ū-hān,’ ǂgui khoen ta ǁnâu ǂgao-e. Tsî da ra ao-ǁnâ ǀga-ra, ǁgâi-e da ga xa-we. Je-sub ge tsau hâ khoe-na ra hui. ǁÎb ǂkhî-ba ra mā da.
English: When we have sinned and feel distressed, When God’s forgiveness we request, Our Lord, Christ Jesus, showed the way To ask for mercy when we pray: “Forgive our debts, we beg of you, As we forgive our debtors too.” We then can let resentment go, And peace of mind and heart we’ll know.

Damara: ǀOa-di-si ǀoa-di-si ǃgâ-san, ǃKhūb ge ra kō-ǃgâ da tsî ǃhūb-aib ǃnâ ra hui da. Hoa-ǁae da ra koa bi. ǀOa-di-si ǀoa-di-sis ǃnâ hân Gao-sib xa ra ǃhoa. E-lob ǀkha da ǀgui-ba ra sî-sen tsî da ra ǃoa-ba bi.
English: When gifts of mercy we bestow, The giving spirit we should show. We give without desiring praise, Content with joy our gift conveys. Then God, who sees all things we do, Will be the One repaying you. Yes, happy are the merciful, In God’s eyes they are beautiful.

Damara: Je-ho-vab ge khoe-xa-si-ba ra ǁgau da. ǁÎb ǀkhā-e ū ta-ma-se ra hâ ū da. ǁÎb khoe-na ǀna-nus tsî so-res tsî-na ra mā tsîb ra ǂû-i tsî ǂkhîb tsî-kha mā. Xū-e ū-hâ ta-ma-na da ge nî ǀkhom, tsî E-lo-ba nî ǁgae ǁîb di ǀgôan a-se. ǁÎb xa da ǃgâi-sib ǃgao nî mā-da-wa-am-he, si-da khoe-xa-sib ge a ǂhau-ǃnâ.
English: Stay awake, stand firm, grow mighty, Be determined to endure. Carry on with manly courage, For the victory is sure. We obey Christ Jesus’ clear command; Under him we firmly take our stand. (CHORUS) Stay awake, stand firm, and grow mighty! Carry on right to the end!

Damara: Hā-nî ǃgâi-ba da tā-tsēs tsî-na nî ǀū ǂhâ-sib ǃnâ hâ-na da ga ra hui-ǂui o. ǃHao khoe-sen ga mû-sen xa-we da nî hui nî tsî ǁîn ǂhâ-si-ga nî ǂhan-sen-ba. ‘Ti ǃhao khoe-do’ dis ge Li-dia-sa ge mî. ǂKhî-ban ra hō si-da oms ǃoan ga hā o. Je-ho-vab E-lob ge nē khoen hoan xa a ǂan, ǁîb khoe-xa-ǃnâ ǀgau-ga ra ǁgae-na.
English: Stay awake, and keep your senses, Always ready to obey. Stay alert to Christ’s direction Through his faithful slave today. Heed the counsel of the older men, Who protect his sheep and truth defend. (CHORUS) Stay awake, stand firm, and grow mighty! Carry on right to the end!

Damara: ǀNam-o-ǃnâ tsî ǃkhai ǃhūb-aib ǃnâb ge E-lob ǁîb ǃoa ge ǂgae da. ǀGui-ǃnâ-xa-sib tsî ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ge ǂkhî-ba ra mā da. ǀGui-ǂâi-xa-sib a ǃgâi tsî da nî ǃgôa-ǃgâ. ǃKhū-ba da ǁkhā-sib hoab ǀkha ra ûi-ba ǂgao, ǀGôab dao-ǁgaus ǃnā-ga. A da ǂgao-ba xu ǁnâu-ǀnam-bi, ǀgui-ǃnâ-xa-sib ǃnâ-ū.
English: Stay awake, remain united As the good news we defend. Though our enemies will fight it, We will preach until the end. Join the shout of praise throughout the land. Look! Jehovah’s day is soon at hand! (CHORUS) Stay awake, stand firm, and grow mighty! Carry on right to the end!

Damara: ǀGui-ǃnâ-xa-sib ǃnâ da nî ǃgû, hoa-ǁae khoe-xa-si-ba ǁgaus ǃnâ. Ob ge ǀnam-mi tsî-na nî kai tsîb ge ǂkhî-ba nî ǀoa. ǀGui-ǃnâ-xa-sib a ǃgâi tsî ǂkhî-ba ra mā. ǃGâ-sa ǃnam-ma da ga ǁgau o, ob ǃKhu-ba ǂkhîb ǀkha nî ǀkhae da. ǁÎb huib ǀkha da nî ǀgui-ǂâi-xa tsî hoa-ǁae nî koa bi.
English: How can I repay you, what gift can I give To thank you, Jehovah, for the life that I live? I look in my heart with your Word as my mirror; The person I see, may you help me see clearer. (BRIDGE) My life I have promised in service to you, But not from mere duty will I do what I do. Whole-souled and wholehearted I serve you by choice; May I be one more who makes you rejoice. Help me to examine, and help me to see Just what sort of person you desire me to be. Those loyal to you, you will loyally treasure; May I be among those who bring your heart pleasure.

Damara: ǂGui ǂkha-bu-sa-si-ga da ge hoa da ū-hâ. Xa-web ge E-lo-ba kō-ǃgâ tsî a ǀnam da. ǁÎb ra ǀkhom da tsî ǁîb ǀnam-mi ge a ǀgai-sa. A da ǁîb ǀnam-ma ǃgom-gu ǃnâ hâ-na ǁgau re.
English: Lovingly Jehovah Made provision through his Son For our sins to be forgiven And for death to be undone. If we truly are repentant, His forgiveness we can claim On the basis of Christ’s ransom, Asking pardon in his name.

Damara: ǀNîn ǂkha-bu-sa xa-we ǀgai-sa-se ra mû-sen. Si-da mî-di ge ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ nî în tā ǃao. ǂKha-bu-san E-lob ti, ǁîb ga-gab ta hui nî. Tsâ-ba nî tsî da ǁîn ǁgam-ro-na ra ǀom-bē.
English: We receive such mercy When we act like God above And forgive each other freely, Showing empathy and love. Putting up with one another, Putting hurtfulness away; Showing honor to our brother, Showing love’s surpassing way.

Damara: ǂKha-bu-sa-na da ge ǀgo-ra-ǃgâ ta-ma hâ, xa-we da tsau-ra mî-di ǀkha ra ǀgai-ǀgai nî. A da ǃgao-ǃgâ-xa-se hoa-ǁae ǂkhâ-ǃnâ nî re. Si-da ga ra ǂkhâ-ǃnâ nî o, on ge nî ǀgai.
English: Mercy is a virtue That we all should cultivate. It will keep us from resentment, From the bitterness of hate. When we imitate Jehovah, Who is unsurpassed in love, We will truly be forgiving; We will be like God above.

Damara: Je-ho-vab ge hui-ba ra mā da, kō-ǃgâ ra ǃûi-ao-ga. ǁÎ-gu ai-ǁgaus ge ra dao-ǁgau da, ma-ti da nî ǃgû-sa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ge ǂgom-ǂgom-sa tsî ǂgom-ǃgâ, da nî ao-ga ge ǀkhae da. ǁÎ-gu ge ra ǂhan-sen ǁÎb gūn ǃgao. Dī-gu ran ǃgao ǀnam gu re.
English: This is at last bone of my bone, Flesh of my flesh; now I’m not alone. God has provided a partner, Someone to call my own. Now we are one; now there can be Blessings to share for you and for me. As man and woman together, We are a family. Ev’ry day we’ll serve our God above. As he shows the way, Unfailing love we’ll display. As we have vowed, so may it be. Seasons of joy, may we come to see. Oh, may we honor Jehovah, And may you always be my love.

Damara: ǀNam da ǃûi-ao-gu ra tsâ-ba da. ǃGâi-se gu ra dao-ǁgau. ǁÎ-gu ge ra hui tsû da ga o, kai ǃgâi ǂgao-sib hoab ǀkha. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ge ǂgom-ǂgom-sa tsî ǂgom-ǃgâ, da nî ao-ga ge ǀkhae da. ǁÎ-gu ge ra ǂhan-sen ǁÎb gūn ǃgao. Dī-gu ran ǃgao ǀnam gu re.
English: Precious to God, we are daughters and sons, Giving our strength as his faithful young ones. Loving attention to us he will give, Blessing our days for as long as we live.

Damara: E-lob ǀa-pe-mā-de gu ra mā, î da tā ǂkha-bu-ǂâi. ǁNās ǀkha gu ra E-lob ǀgaub ǀkha hui, î da ǃKhū-ba ǃoa-ba. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) E-lob ge ǂgom-ǂgom-sa tsî ǂgom-ǃgâ, da nî ao-ga ge ǀkhae da. ǁÎ-gu ge ra ǂhan-sen ǁÎb gūn ǃgao. Dī-gu ran ǃgao ǀnam gu re.
English: Honoring parents who care for our lives Helps us express what we’re feeling inside. Then we find favor with God and with men, Drawing us close to Jehovah, our Friend.

Damara: ǀKhom-xa-ǃnâ E-lo si-da ǂgae-ǂgui-ao, kai-se du si-da ǂgao-gu xa kai. Si-da ǃgom-si-ga su-pu-su-pu re, ǁkhae-ǂgao da re Sa-du ga-gab ǃnâ-ū.
English: May we remember our God in our youth, Growing each day in our love of the truth. Giving our best to our God, we will bring Joy to the heart of Jehovah, our King.

Damara: Hoa da ge a ǁo-re-ao si-da ǁGû. ǀNî ǁae-ga da nē daob ǃnâ ra ǁnā. ǀKhom-ma du da ge ra ǁnâu-am da re. Sa-du ga-gab ǃnâ-ū dao-ǁgau da re.
English: When a man becomes a father And a woman has a child of her own, They share a trust, they must remember, That is not theirs, not theirs alone. The gift they share is from Jehovah; Of life and love he is the one true Source. To parents he gives sure direction That they may follow the wisest course. (CHORUS) A sacred trust you have been given; A precious life is in your hands. You can bestow the greatest favor; Instruct your child in God’s commands.

Damara: Hoa-ǁae da ga tsau tsî ǂkha-bu-ǂâi o, ob E-lob ga-ga-ba ra ǀgai kai. Kai a-nib kha-mi ī ǀgai-ba mā da; a da ǁnâi sa-du ga-ga-ba hō re.
English: All the words God has commanded— They must always prove to be on your heart. These words you’ll speak to sons and daughters; This is your trust, this is your part. To them you’ll speak along your roadway, When you rise up and when you are at rest. In years to come, may they remember, May they be faithful, may they be blessed. (CHORUS) A sacred trust you have been given; A precious life is in your hands. You can bestow the greatest favor; Instruct your child in God’s commands.

Damara: E-lob ǀnam tsî-ra ǁkhau-ǂui da: ‘Ti-ta ǀkha ǃgû îts ǀnam te.’ E-lob tsî khoe-na da ge nî ǀnam tsî ǃgâi ǀgau-ga nî ǁgau. ǁNā-pa-xū i ge ûi-ba hâ, ǁnāb ge ôa da ra ûi-ba. Je-sub ǀnam-mi ge ǁnā ti-de. Je-sub ǀnam-ma da ra mû.
English: Jehovah is faithful and fully aware Of all those who serve him whole-souled. He knows there are times their devotion and zeal Result in their loss as foretold. If you have left houses or fam’ly or friends, Be sure that our God knows the sum. He makes it up now with our dear brotherhood And life in the new world to come. (CHORUS) May Jehovah reward what you have done. May he provide a perfect wage for you. May you find refuge beneath his wings. Jehovah is faithful; Jehovah is true.

Damara: ǀNam-mi ra ǂgae da ǃgâi-ba ǃoa; E-lob ǀnam-mi ra hui da. Dī-sā da ga ob ra hui da, ǁÎb huib ǀkha da ge ra ǀgai. ǀNam-mi ge a ǃa-nu tsîb ge ǀnam-ma su-ri ta-ma hâ. ǁGū-tsâ re ǃgâ-sa-na ǀnam-sa. A da tsâ a-ma ǀnam-ma.
English: At times we may feel that our lot in this life Has burdened us more than our share. And sometimes it seems that the cares of the day Are more than we’re able to bear. The God of all comfort takes note of your need; You know he’s the Hearer of prayer. His Word and his spirit and true, loving friends Will bring to you comfort and care. (CHORUS) May Jehovah reward what you have done. May he provide a perfect wage for you. May you find refuge beneath his wings. Jehovah is faithful; Jehovah is true.

Damara: Ab tā ǁai-ba ǂgae-ǂgui da re. Ab tā sa-do ǂgae-ǂha-pu. E-lob ǃoa kō re hoa-ǁae ob ge ǁî-ba nî ǁkhā-ǁkhā du. E-lob tsî khoe-na da nî ǀnam tsî ǃgâi ǀgau-ga nî ǁgau nî. Hoa-ǁae khoe-na ǀnam-ma ǁgau re E-lob a ǀnam kha-mi ǀnam.
English: Sarah and Esther, Mary, Ruth, and others— All these were capable women, loyal wives. Godly devotion was foremost in their lives. They were faithful women, ones we know by name. There were others favored by Jehovah; Nameless in the record, their faith was just the same.

Damara: ǃGôa-sib ǃnâ da E-lo-ba ra ǂgan, î da ǁîb ǀgau-gu hoa-ga ǁgae ǁkhā. Xa-we hoa xūn ǂam-ai hâ i ge ǀnam-ma, E-lob ga-gab ta hau-ba. ǁKhoa-ǂgao tsî da ga gā-ai xa-web ga sa-da ǀnam-ma ǃkhai, o i ǁau. ǃGam ǀnam-ma da ge nî ǀgo-re-ba, si-da ǀgau-gu hoa-gu ǃnâ ǁgaus ǀkha.
English: Goodness and courage, loyal love and kindness— Lovable qualities in all humankind, Virtues these excellent women bring to mind. They were fine examples we appreciate. In the same way now our Christian sisters Show a faithful spirit we all can imitate.

Damara: ǀNam-mi ge ǃgâi-ba mā-sa ra ôa tsî ǀnam-mi ge nau khoen xa ra ǂâi. ǀNam-mi ge ǃhui ta-ma hâ ǂgaob ǃnâ. Je-sub ge ge ǁkhā-ǁkhā ǀû-ba-gu. ǀNam-mi ǃnū-ǃnâ-xa-sib ǀkha ra hui, tsû-ba ta-ni ǁkhā ǀgai-sab ga o. Mâ ǃgom-mi hoab ǃnâ ǀnam-ma ǁgau re. ǀNam-mi ge hoa xū-na ra ta-ni.
English: Mothers and daughters, sisters, wives, and widows, Willingly laboring, glad to do your part. Modest your bearing, submissive is your heart, Having God’s approval, may you never fear. Christian sisters, may Jehovah keep you Firm in your conviction, your prize is drawing near.

Damara: Je-ho-vab ge ǀnam-ma hoa da ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā. Nē ǀgaub ge ra hui da, ǁÎb ra sî-sen-ū da ǀgaub nē-sa ra ǁgau ma-ti da ǀnam-ma nî ǁgau-sa. ǀGui-se ǃnae hâ ǀGôa-bab ge si-da ǃgao mā Îb si-da ǁo-re-na ǀGôab ǃnâ-ū ǀû-ba. Nēs ge ǁÎb ǀnam-mi di kai ǁgâi-ǂui-sen-sa! ǁÎb ǀgaub ge ǀnam, E-lob ǀgaub ge ǀnam.
English: Here with us are aged ones, Those whose youth has passed. Here among us they endure; Still they’re holding fast. Loss of strength besets them all; Loss of mates for some. Father, please confirm their faith In the life to come. (CHORUS) Father, you remember How in faith they’ve run. Give them your assurance; May they hear, “Well done!”

Damara: Nē ǀgaub ǃnâ ǃgû tsî da ǀnam-ma ǁgau-gu re ǃgam tsî a-ma-ai-ba, ǃGâ-sa-na tsâ-bas ǀkhab ge ǀnam-ma ra hui, kai-ran tsî ǀa-san hoa-na o. E-lob tsî khoe-na da a-ma ǀnam-ma nî ǁgau tsî nē ǀnam-ma da ge ǃkhō-oa ti-de. Si-da ǃgâ-san ǁo-re-na da nî ǀû-ba tsî ǁnās ǀkha ǃgâ-sa ǀnam-ma nî ǁgau.
English: Splendid is gray-headedness Found in ways of right. Beautiful are faithful ones In Jehovah’s sight. May we always recognize They were once young too. Loyally they gave their best When their strength was new. (CHORUS) Father, you remember How in faith they’ve run. Give them your assurance; May they hear, “Well done!”

Damara: ǀNam-mi ai-ǁgaus ge ra ǀgui-ǃnâ-xa kai da î da khoe-ǃgâ-gu kai. Si-da ǀhom-si ǁGûb ge hoa da ra ǁkhau-ǂui: “Tsâ a-ma ǀgui-ǃnâ-xa-si-ba.” ǀNam-mi tsî ǂkhîb si-da ra ǁgau-ǂuib ǃnâ ǁhao, E-lob ǁîb ga-gab tsî mîs ǃnâ-ū ra hui. Si-da ǃgâ-san hoan ge ra hō-hō-ǃnâ da. E-lob ge ǀnam. Je-ho-vab ge ǀnam.
English: Ev’ry newborn child, Ev’ry drop of rain, Ev’ry golden ray of sun, Each head of grain— All are gifts from God; They reveal his way. Miracles performed by him sustain us each day. (CHORUS) So, what are we to do with a gift so rare But to love the One who gave it and show him we care. No matter what we do, We never can earn it. This gift is still a gift​—The miracle of life.

Damara: ǃKhūb ge ǀnam, ǂhau-ǃnâ-se. ǀHom-ma xub ra hoa da kō-ǃgâ. E-lob ge ǁîb di ǀGôab ǃnâ-ū, xo-re-ma-ri-ba ge a mā, î da ǃâu-ba-sen-sa ū-hâ, hâ-hâ nî-ra ǂkhîb tsî ûib xa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Sa-du hî-na ra ǁgâ do, hā î du ûib ǁgam-me ā. Hā î du ā, ǁgâ hâ-do. Î du ǃKhūb ǀnam-ma mû.
English: Others may give up, Lose their will to try, Echoing the wife of Job: “Curse God and die.” We are not that way; Praise to God we give, Thanking him for ev’ry precious moment we live. (CHORUS) So, what are we to do with a gift so rare But to love the ones around us and show them we care. No matter what we do, We never can earn it. This gift is still a gift​—The miracle of life.

Damara: ǃKhūb ge ǀnam, ǂhau-ǃnâ-se. ǁÎb ku-rus ge ǀnam-ma ra ǁgau. E-lob ge nē-sa ge ǁgau da, Je-su-bab ge tron-sa mā o. ǃKhūb ǂâi-ba-sens ge ǃgâi nē-si. ǁÎb Gao-sib ra ǂgae-ǂgui tsoa-tsoa. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Sa-du hî-na ra ǁgâ do, hā î du ûib ǁgam-me ā. Hā î du ā, ǁgâ hâ-do. Î du ǃKhūb ǀnam-ma mû.
English: The God of times and of seasons, Whose name alone is Jehovah— The time for his vindication Is near by signs we can see. (CHORUS) Keep on working and watching and waiting, Joyfully anticipating, Life as God meant it to be.

Damara: ǃKhūb ge ǀnam, ǂhau-ǃnâ-se. Ab ǁÎb ǀgai-ba hui î da ǀnam. Tsau ra-na da ra hui hî-na, E-lob mî-san ra ôa ǁaeb ǃnâ. A da E-lob ǃao-ba ū-hâ, ǁKhoa-se da ga ra ao-ǁnâ o. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Sa-du hî-na ra ǁgâ do, hā î du ûib ǁgam-me ā. Hā î du ā, ǁgâ hâ-do. Î du ǃKhūb ǀnam-ma mû.
English: The time has long been appointed; His Son is ready to conquer, Defeating all who oppose him. His sword will bring victory. (CHORUS) Keep on working and watching and waiting, Joyfully anticipating, Life as God meant it to be.

Damara: Si-da ǀnam-mi ga ǀae-xa o, ob ge Je-ho-va-ba ra ǂkhî. ǀNam-mi ge ǁîb mâ-ǂoa ra ǀgau tsî si-da ǀgū-se hâ. ǀNam-mi ge ǂgaob ǃnâ ǀgui hâ ǁkhā tsî ǂhau-ǃnâ ǀhō-sa-na ra om. ǀNam-mi ǁîb xa ǀgui ǂâi ta-ma. ǀNam-ma ǃgâi-se ǁgau re. ǂHâ-sib ǃnâ hâ-e da ge hui-ba nî-ra mā tsî nî hâ-ba. A-ma-bes ǃnâ da ge a, ǀhō-sa gu ǁkhā hoan ǃoa-ai. Je-sub ge ǀnam-ma ge ǁgau da, î da Je-ho-vab ǀnam-ma mû îb si-da ǂgao-ba tsâ-ǀkhā ǁkhā. Khoe-xa-ǃnâ-sib ge tsoa-tsoa. ǂGao-ba xu ǀae-xa-se ǀnam.
English: Though all creation is groaning, In faith we’re eagerly waiting. Jehovah’s day is approaching, The time for setting us free. (CHORUS) Keep on working and watching and waiting, Joyfully anticipating, Life as God meant it to be.

Damara: Nē ǁaeb ge E-lob Gao-sib ǃoa ra ǁnae-ǁgau. Hoa khoe-na da ra ao-ǁnâ-ba. Ais-ǀkhāb ǃoa kō tsî sa-du o-re-sa mû, o-res ǁaeb ge go ǀgū-ba da! (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab ge si-da ǂkhîb di ǀgai-ba. ǃGa-ri-se ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha ǁnae. Tsî dâ ǃâu-ba-sens ǃnâ tsî gan-gan bi re. Tsî ǀhom-mi ǃnâ hâ E-lo-ba koa. Je-ho-vab ge si-da ǂkhîb di ǀgai-ba. ǁÎb kai-si-ban hoa-na nî ǂan. Tsî da ǀu-nis kō-se ǃKhū-ba nî ǃoa-ba. Tsî da E-lob ǂkhî-ba nî-ra ǁgau.
English: A paradise our God has promised, By means of Christ’s Millennial Reign, When he’ll blot out all sin and error, Removing death and tears and pain. (CHORUS) A paradise, the earth will be. With eyes of faith, this we can see. This promise Christ will soon fulfill, For he delights to do God’s will.

Damara: Je-ho-vab ǃoa kō re, ǁî-ba a ǀnam do. Tā ǃao re ǁÎb ge a ǀgai-sa. Khâi mâ tsî du ǃga-ri dom-mi ǀkha ǁnae re. ǃKhū-ba ǂkhîb am-sa ǁnae-ba re! (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab ge si-da ǂkhîb di ǀgai-ba. ǃGa-ri-se ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha ǁnae. Tsî dâ ǃâu-ba-sens ǃnâ tsî gan-gan bi re. Tsî ǀhom-mi ǃnâ hâ E-lo-ba koa. Je-ho-vab ge si-da ǂkhîb di ǀgai-ba. ǁÎb kai-si-ban hoa-na nî ǂan. Tsî da ǀu-nis kō-se ǃKhū-ba nî ǃoa-ba. Tsî da E-lob ǂkhî-ba nî-ra ǁgau.
English: Soon here on earth, as God has purposed, His Son will cause the dead to rise. Then it will be as Jesus promised: ‘You’ll be with me in Paradise.’ (CHORUS) A paradise, the earth will be. With eyes of faith, this we can see. This promise Christ will soon fulfill, For he delights to do God’s will.

Damara: Si-da ǂkhîb ǃa-ro-mas ge a kai, ǃkhū-sib ra ǂgui-ǂgui-sen kha-mi. E-lob ǃoa-ai a ǀō-ai-san ge mâ ǃhaos hoa-sa xu ra hā-na. Si-da ǂgaob ge kai ǂkhîb xa ra ǀoa, ǁÎb mîs ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā xū-na xu. ǁÎb ge tsēs hoa-sa ra ǁkhā-ǁkhā da; tsîs nē-sa ǂgom-sa ra om-khâi. ǃGom-sin ga hā xa-we da ra ǂkhî tsîb ge nē ǂkhî-ba nî hâ-hâ. ǃGom-sin ga hā-ǂam da xa-web ge E-lo-ba hoa-ǁae nî hui da. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab ge ǂkhî-ba ra mā. ǁÎb ǃom-gu sî-sen-ni ǀga-pi. ǁÎb ǂâi-di tsî sî-sen-gu ge ǀga-pi, nēs xū-i ǀkha a ǀnō-e ǁoa.
English: The Paradise, our Lord has promised, And he is now our reigning King. We daily thank our loving Father, And from our hearts, his praises sing. (CHORUS) A paradise, the earth will be. With eyes of faith, this we can see. This promise Christ will soon fulfill, For he delights to do God’s will.

Damara: ǁÎb ku-ru-sa da ǂkhîb ǀkha ra kō, ǁÎb ǀhom-aib tsî ǃhūb-aib tsî-na. ǁÎb ku-rus ǂkha-nis ǃnâ da ra kō tsî ǃom-gu sî-sen-ga ra koa. ǀŪ ta-ma-se da nî-ra ao-ǁnâ tsî E-lob Gao-sib xa nî ǃhoa. ǁÎb di ǂgae-ǂguis tsî ǀkhaeb xa da nî ǃgâi-a-ǂgaob ǀkha hoa-ǁae nî ǃhoa. ǀAm-o ǂkhîb xa da ge nî ǀoa-he, tsēs ǃui-sa ra saos ǁkhās kha-mi. Nē ǀa-sa ǃhūb-aib tsî ǀhom-mi ge mî-hē ǁoa-sa ǂkhî-ba nî hau. (ǁNAEǀHAOS) Je-ho-vab ge ǂkhî-ba ra mā. ǁÎb ǃom-gu sî-sen-ni ǀga-pi. ǁÎb ǂâi-di tsî sî-sen-gu ge ǀga-pi, nēs xū-i ǀkha a ǀnō-e ǁoa.
English: “The signs of the times” prove God’s rule has begun. In glory enthroned sits Jehovah’s Son. The heavens are cleansed, Satan’s now debased, And soon on the earth let God’s will take place. (CHORUS) Rejoice! For God’s tent is with men, And he himself resides with them. No more will there be pain or worrying, No sting of death nor any sorrowing. For God has said: ‘I’m making all things new.’ These words faithful are and true.

Damara: Je-ho-va ǂkhîb E-lob, ǂkhî-ba du ge a mî-mâi. Sa-du ga-ga-ba da ra ǂgan îb ga-gab ǂû-ga kai-kai. Je-sub ǃnâ da ra ǂgom ǁÎb a ǂhau-ǃnâ a-ma-ga. A da ǁîb di ǀhō-sa kai re, nēs ǂkhî-ba ra mā da o.
English: Let all men the pure New Jerusalem see, The bride of the Lamb shining radiantly. Adorned for her husband in gems so bright, And only Jehovah will be her light. (CHORUS) Rejoice! For God’s tent is with men, And he himself resides with them. No more will there be pain or worrying, No sting of death nor any sorrowing. For God has said: ‘I’m making all things new.’ These words faithful are and true.

Damara: Ga-gab ge ra hui da, Sa-du mîs ǃnâ-ba ra mā. Dao-ǁgau-he tsî da ra sâu-he, nē ǃhūb-aib hî-na ǃkhaeb ǃnâ. ǁAeb ge nî-ra hā hoa ǂkha-ba-dī-gu nî bē-sa. Sa-du ga-ga-bab hui da re, ǂkhî-ba ū-hâ ǀga-ras ǀkha.
English: This city so grand will become a delight. Its gates will be open both day and night. The nations will walk in her glory bright; The servants of God now reflect that light. (CHORUS) Rejoice! For God’s tent is with men, And he himself resides with them. No more will there be pain or worrying, No sting of death nor any sorrowing. For God has said: ‘I’m making all things new.’ These words faithful are and true.

Damara: ǀNam du an ge ra ǀgui, ǀhom-mi tsî ǃhūb-aib tsîn ǃnâ. Ga-gab ra ǀgui-ǃnâ-xa kai da tsî Gao-sib xa ra ao-ǁnâ. Tsî Gao-sib ge ǀgū-ǁae, to-ro-ga nî-ra ǀam kai. Tsî ǃgâi-ba ra dīn ge nî ǂkhî, ǀam-o-sib kō-se ûi-sa.
English: The living God, Jehovah, you have proved to be; Your mighty works abound in earth and sky and sea. No rival god can equal what you have done ​—there is none. Our foes will be consumed. (CHORUS) Jehovah provides escape for the loyal. His servants will see what a mighty Crag is he. So with courage and faith in our God, we spread the fame Of Jehovah, our Source of escape, and praise his name.

Damara: Je-ho-va E-lob ǀgui-ǃnâ-xa-sib di-ba koa. ǁÎb to-ro-ga ra ǀū kai tsî ra ǀgui kai dab. ǂKhîb Gaob ge Je-su-ba, ǀkhom-xa tsî a ǃgâi-ba. ǂHa-nu-ai-sib ǃnâb ge si-da ǃgao a mâ-ǀgai.
English: Though ropes of death encircle me, I call to you, “Jehovah, give me strength, and give me courage too.” From your own temple dwelling, you hear my plea, “Shelter me; Rescue me, O my God.” (CHORUS) Jehovah provides escape for the loyal. His servants will see what a mighty Crag is he. So with courage and faith in our God, we spread the fame Of Jehovah, our Source of escape, and praise his name.

Damara: Tsû-tsû ra mîn tsî ǂkha-bab tsî-na da ra ǀū. ǃKham-ū-he ra xūn ǀkha da ǂkhîb xū-na ra dī. ǀÛ-ba-gu da ra ǂkhî-ba da ra ǂgao ǃkhais ǃgao. Je-sub gūn a-se da ǂkhîb ǃnâ nî-ra hâ-ǀhao.
English: From heaven you will thunder and give forth your voice. Your enemies will quake; your servants will rejoice. You prove to be whatever you need to be; all will see How you provide escape. (CHORUS) Jehovah provides escape for the loyal. His servants will see what a mighty Crag is he. So with courage and faith in our God, we spread the fame Of Jehovah, our Source of escape, and praise his name.
